Reviews.Title: “Westin Heaven”
Reviews.Author: RMGTravel
Reviews.Content: The LeWestin is perfectly located in the midst of Montreal - and steps from Old Montreal. Beautifully appointed rooms and excellent staff. Makes business travel a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bortojo
Reviews.Content: Very nice Westin location. Nice lobby with and we had a large room with a separate room and a pull out couch for the kids. Pool area has 3 different pools with varying temperatures and the largest has a glass bottom overlooking the entrance. Wireless was very unreliable in the room but worked well in the lobby and restaurant. Breakfast buffet was great if a little pricey, however the kids were free so that made a big difference. Easy walk to Old Montreal and the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mptravis
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel perfectly located. We walked everywhere and never took the car in our 4 nights there. Clean, friendly staff, nicely appointed throughout. The restaurant, Gazette was excellent for breakfast and lunch, we ate dinner at area restaurants but I'm sure we wouldn't have been disappointed. April is an "ok" time to be in Montreal, a little too soon but still a beautiful city to explore none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: hamac
Reviews.Content: Got a room on the 10th floor. Two queen beds, large sitting area with 2 big chairs. A desk was available for the laptop. Internet access was a little bit slow. The view was quite ordinary because we were looking at the office building across the street. The restaurant is good but the prices are way too high. Breakfast for two at 48$, lunch for five at 200$. The reviews that mentionned the comfortable beds are quite right the sheets are fresh and crisps. When i got there at 18h00 on a thursday the hotel parking was full and i had to go to another parking une the centre des congrÃ¨s across the street. A real big advantage is the centre des congrÃ¨s right across the St-Antoine street. The chinese quarters is just a street down and you can find plenty of restaurants within a 10 minutes walk. All in all a hotel I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvrudy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 1 1/2 year old daughter last summer and we loved it. The breakfast buffet in the hotel resto is amazing! Staff is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Nice Bar!”
Reviews.Author: Alaverdyan
Reviews.Content: The reasons of me rating Le Westin Montreal as three are the following: - Weird structure/architecture, you need to take an escalator, walk for a few minutes until you get to the lift that takes you to your floor - The pool is very small for a hotel like Le Westin, I am sure they could've done better with the space they have. - When one's on a business trip and spending hours in meetings / workshops, it is important to be in a "relaxing" atmosphere when you come back to the hotel lounge, bar, etc. The foyer is always very busy, the bar is almost full every evening, very noisy, and doesn't have an ambiance. - It's like a convention centre, always very busy Positive points: -Good rooms, spacious, although with empty mini bars - Front-desk, bar and restaurant staff are very friendly and provide great service - It's only 5-10 minutes walking away from the Old Town that has good restaurants, souvenir shops, etc I am rating Le Westin comparing it to other hotels in the same class and I think my rating is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerCa_11
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here dozens of times traveling for work. It's a newer hotel with big comfortable rooms. Staff are generally pleasant and the food available in the hotel is decent. Nice gym and pool that don't seem to get very crowded. Location wise, this hotel is in a great spot: I can walk to the office in the business centre and it's a stone's throw from old Montreal. Definitely a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, Nice, Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: MattZup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with a group of 15 for a bachelor party. We had a total of 5 rooms. Very nice hotel, service was accomodating. Nothing spectacular about it, but all of the important things were covered. Bed was comfortable, people were nice. Did not visit the pool, although you can see the bottom of the pull from the driveway outside, which was pretty neat. Some guys complained about the pillows, but I didn't notice them. Close enough to all the action of Montreal without being in the center of craziness. On the expensive side, but probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: James1111111
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more when staying here. Rooms are great and the staff are all amazing too! The gazette restaurant is also a great place to catch up with friends and co-workers. Easy access to Montreal underground for those cold days too.

Reviews.Title: “Continue to return”
Reviews.Author: BillParker
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel for business and vacation. An excellent location with great rooms and restaurant. Walking into the Old City is quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “Le Westin very good”
Reviews.Author: MandM_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous comments fit with our experience, overall service was very accommodating and friendly, hotel was modern and rooms were clean. Highlights: pool was neat but pictures make it look much larger than it really is. There are actually three pools, one "lap pool" which is a little more than one lane wide, a "hot tub" and a "cold tub". Note that there's no change room on the pool level (that we could see) so you may be left with a dripping wet bathing suit all the way back to your room. Hotel location is great - Convention Centre is right across the street (with the multi-coloured glass windows)with a few restaurants such as Subway (the sandwich shop) and a convenience store. Metro is only a block or two - no more than a five minute - walk away. For some reason, Mapquest/Googlemaps seemed to make everything appear much further away than it really is. Not as great: we stayed in a two bedroom suite, with a king bed in one room and a pullout couch in the other. King bed was great, however, not clear that an adult would be comfortable sleeping on the pullout, think of a design with a metal support bar in the middle of it. Parking was only available by valet ($24 per day), and they took 20 minutes to get our car. Not sure if parking across the street was cheaper? Also note that in our room, it only had a shower (no bathtub). This wasn't a problem for us, but maybe for others. Note: if travelling to Montreal for first time, and if you're coming from the West, note that quite a few (all?) exits off the highway to downtown are on the left (not right) hand side, so be prepared! Also, the location of the Westin requires a number of rapid turns after exiting from the highway, so you may want to check the directions beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny new hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffHoPhoto
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin on a business trip last February and was absolutely pleased with my stay. I also just returned from the Hilton Bonaventure, so my comments are in comparison with that hotel. The room at the Weston were quite large and the decor was first class. I may have obtained a members upgrade, so consider getting signed up for their points program. I have a fondness for new hotels and this one is right up there. I stayed at the Bonaventure as the Charity Gala I was attending was being held there and was wishing I had stayed at the Westin instead. The only exception was the Hilton had a great executive lounge. The location is great for those wishing to walk to Old Montreal after a hard day at work. It makes for a refreshing walk even in a Montreal Winter! I would strongly consider this place when I bring my family into town. It is all right along St. Laurent, so walking north 2 blocks gets you into Chinatown for great, inexpensive food.

Reviews.Title: “A businesslike business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sputnik62ms
Reviews.Content: My first ever trip to Montreal (or Canada, for that matter!) Business trip, so we get to stay at our preferred Starwood properties. First impressions were OK - although the lobby does the hotel no favors, as it looks so sparse and generally unwelcoming. Staff were good throughout the hotel - especially the concierge, who was an endless source of good dining suggestions in the the city. The room was fine. Everything worked, there were some nice touches like the Westin own-label toiletries, etc., and quite a few little environmentally-friendly things, too. And then there's the bed. Westin are famous for their "heavenly" beds, and rightly so. I've rarely slept so well in my life! A definite highlight. The rest of the hotel was good, without being spectacular. However, the food is worth mentioning as, to me, anyway, it was well above the usual standard for a hotel of this kind. Once again, service in the restaurant/bar was very good. All in all, worth their 4 stars, but not terribly representative of the whole Montreal experience (despite being situated in the older part of the city).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 2 nights while in town for work. The hotel is in a great location in the old town with many restaurants and historic sites in walking distance. The check-in was fast and friendly; the rate came with buffet breakfast and happy hour drinks. As a platinum member, my room was upgraded and was fantastic .. very large, with a separate seating area with a view into the old town. Standard Westin bed (very comfy) and large bathroom with kohler fixtures and a great shower (good water pressure). The room was also very quiet .. no noise from the next rooms. Their was an inroom coffee maker with Starbucks and bottle's of water. I have stayed at the other SPG properties in town and would say this hotel is definitely my favorite of the group. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend the property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Westin brand and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: The room and hotel lived up to the standard that we have come to expect from the Westin brand. The room was quite spacious featuring high end fittings and furnishings. The bed was comfortable and the view from the window was fantastic. The location of the hotel is pretty good right on the edge of Old Montreal and a reasonable walk to down town. The buffet breakfast was pretty good but felt like it could have done with some more choices. Service from the staff was excellent and we will definitely stay here again next time we are in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: canadianpeach27
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I booked this hotel to stay in Montreal during our trip through Quebec. We stayed for 2 nights and were beyond impressed. The location was ideal, walking distance to both new and old Montreal. Lots of shopping and restaurants just within a short distance. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and accomidating. Loved the pool and hot tub .. we even tried out the cold pool (for 3 seconds). Our room was just a standard king, but it was huge! Nice big bathroom with large frameless glass shower. I would highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay again if and when we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stylish, and Very Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: ek050
Reviews.Content: Hotel: We booked our king bed room through Hotels.com and were very happy with it. It was nice a spacious size, very clean, and the ipod docking station was really handy. The bed and pillows were so comfy and this may sounds strange, but the room and the rest of the hotel had this really nice subtle vanilla-ish relaxing scent. Location: The location was great, it took maybe 10 mins to walk to St. Catherine Street for shopping and it was only about 5 mins to the water in the other direction. There was only valet parking but it was reasonably priced at $26 per day (after tax) which may seem high but I've paid $35 in Toronto at a lower end hotel so I was fine with it. Food: Restaurant wise I found there weren't too many options within walking distance (it was a cold weekend and we weren't willing to walk too far), there were a lot of higher priced restaurants but we just wanted something casual. We did find a great Chinese restaurant called Papillion Bleu and if you exit through the big glass door by the elevators instead of through the lobby you pop out almost right in front of it. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Tips_AB
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't overly impressive, but the service was fast & friendly and the location was good. We almost booked a hotel in the heart of Old Montreal, and we're really glad we didn't! We took a stroll through Old Montreal on Sunday afternoon, and it felt really dead - many of the shops and restaurants were actually closed. I was really surprised, because I had been there in the summer before and it was incredibly vibrant and bustling. It has an outdoor skating rink, so I thought Old Montreal would be just as busy as the summer. Or that shops would be open at the very least! Back to the hotel - the pool with the glass bottom was fun, but it was jam-packed with kids every time we went. The pool had an attendant, which was nice, but the attendants never asked the kids (or parents) to refrain from doing cannonballs into the pool, which got to be rather annoying for those getting splashed in the adjacent hot tub! I know that makes me sound old and curmudgeonly, but running around a pool doing haphazard cannonballs seems potentially dangerous, not just disruptive. The gym was great - clean and well-equipped. The room service was prompt and excellent. The morning breakfast buffet at The Gazette, on the other hand, was over-crowded and over-priced. We had to wait about 15 minutes to get a seat at the bar (not even a table!) and apparently we were lucky - the line to get in snaked all the way out the door when we left. At $22 a person, we would have been better off ordering off the menu. The buffet was ok, but I think $12 would have been a more reasonable price considering the selection. Loved the free wi-fi and in-room coffee. One minor housekeeping gripe: I opened the sealed shower cap and found it had already been used, and was full of soap! That was gross. Overall, though, I'd stay there again. It was comfortable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSparrow
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just steps from Old Montreal. We enjoyed that everything was within walking distance and how well connected we were to the rest of the city via metro. The rooms are quite large and we had a nice view of the river which was a plus. The staff were courteous and the hotel had good amenities - to be expected of a Westin. A solid choice in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: Checked in late and ordered room service which unfortunately was very poorly done and tasted old. There are 2 wings are we were placed in the older, refurbished one which was done well, except for some peeling wallpaper on the walls. Beds, pillows were exceptionally comfortable. The hotel does not have any Starbucks or coffee shop of the like so we had to go across the Congress building which had an array of food courts and restaurants. Car parking is valet only and $25.00 ++/night. The back door leads to the end of old Montreal which is convenient for walking weather permitting. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful without appearing condescending since we do not speak French. Tried the buffet breakfast the next day, one of the fruit bowls had hair in it so did not bother to get any cantaloupe from that. Service was quick. Loved that they had New York times for the weekend, there were no newspapers placed on the door as advertised on the hotel brochure. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Montreal and this is the best one in terms of cleanliness. Room service needs to be improved .

Reviews.Title: “Quality as expected”
Reviews.Author: tripopinonsw
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Old Montreal and not far from St Catherine. Friendly staff, well appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot near old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: maltyone
Reviews.Content: Booked a few nights here again in February, excellent location and service as before. Positives Location, new property, beds of course, and the great staff Con's Valet parking only if cost is a concern, also no longer any service in the club lounge - If you have starwood status they now provide an appy in the evening and breakfast in the morning in the Gazette restaurant downstairs. Will be heading back again soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Business and Meeting Venue”
Reviews.Author: jcapritti
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a client meeting in February 2012, and have probably logged about 5 stays here over the past 2 years. I'm always delighted to learn that this hotel has been booked for these meetings. I was running a small workshop within a larger national conference and found the support of the meeting and banquet staff to be excellent. The service staff were attentive without being intrusive. Timing was spot on. The meals and break foods were delicious. While I didn't get out and about this time, the location is pretty perfect - you've got the best of the old and new Montreal within easy walking. And, after a very long international flight, the quality of the Westin's bedding was a dreamy oasis in my chic, modern and impeccably clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: J_M_S_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in February 2012. I loved the location within walking distance of Old Montreal. The front desk staff was pleasant and efficient. I found the overall decor and layout of the hotel and my room to be stylish, clean and new. I'm not sure if Le Westin Montreal is a new hotel or recently renovated but it sure gave a sparkling new impression! I enjoyed my comfortable king-sized bed with lots of pillows, sleek furniture and lighting fixtures, elegant draperies, and flat-screen TV. The bathroom was spa-like with plush towels, good lighting, mirrors and amenities. For me, the large beautifully-tiled shower was the final cherry on top! For a downtown hotel catering to business crowds, the price of $179/night was reasonable for everything I experienced. I was very impressed with Le Westin Montreal and plan to return for either business or personal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: Westin Hotels are reliably awesome and this one has not disappointed. I have stayed here twice, some things which stand out are the location close to Old Town, Chinatown. The pool/gym area is a must visit. The pool really is over the entrance driveway and you can really look thru the bottom of the pool at people and cars-they have masks for the kids. Rooms are very quiet, restaurant in the hotel is very good as well. Many good choices in Montreal, and this is one of the best

Reviews.Title: “j0new@hotmail.com”
Reviews.Author: Uphototraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Fabulous location right between Old Montreal and the main city. The hotel is beautiful and clean. Very comfy beds, and great internet service. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly N
Reviews.Content: When I was there, the hotel was practically brand new - the pool and gym weren't even finished yet! Needless to say, our room was BEAUTIFUL! We actually booked this hotel last-minute after checking out of a very disappointing hotel that we had originally booked. The 3 of us stayed in a large room with a King sized bed - and it didn't feel cramped AT ALL. I felt like I was in heaven! The bathroom was gorgeous and I loved everything about this hotel! It's beautiful, with friendly and attentive staff. And although the pool and gym weren't finished yet, the hotel was PROACTIVE -- they had already previously arranged with the hotel next door for Westin guests to use their facilities! FABULOUS. I must say, I was impressed because MANY hotels fail to be proactive, so this was a HUGE plus for me. Thank you for being the best hotel I've ever stayed at in Montreal! (I selected March 2011, because there were no options prior to that)

Reviews.Title: “Hip Westin in Old Montreal that is walking distance to some amazing architectural finds”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Located across from the convention center you would at first thought think- oh man nothing good to eat around here. Well that is a true statement until you set out up the hill a bit walking and you stumble into various parts of Old Monteal that are really breathtaking at night. Granted it was snowing, some holiday decor was still up, and there are churches lit up in pale lavender blue lighting...very picturesque. The hotel is also lit up in the same chic blueish lighting, has a very inviting lobby, and is well spread out. Club Lounge on roof top is well appointed, has free cold water, juice, etc., and has good views over city. Gym is very large and plenty of cardio machines as well as moderate free weights, machines, and a pool/jacuzzi - no steam/sauna FYI. Restaurant downstairs is good place to grab some drinks, and breakfast is grand (free for Platinum guests); but again go into the city for some real food. I suggest Les 400 Coups (10 min walk) - food was high end NYC standards. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: livelaughandtravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few hotels while travelling and I have always wanted to stay in The Westin, so we finally did. Luckily, our stay was free due to rewards points. The hotel is nice, but not $226 worth a night kind of nice. The room had a king size bed and beautiful walk in shower winning over my partner, but I was expecting a little more for that kind of hotel. Maybe it's because The Westin in Ottawa just seems so grand and spectactular. The hotel has a small pool, looks good though, but no spa, that was a downside for us, as we were looking to attend the spa. We ate dinner, lunch and breakfast in the hotel (our breakfast was included), dinner was just okay, and lunch was just okay, but I did enjoy the breakfast. Overall, the hotel is located perfectly in Montreal, with old Montreal right behind it, everything is walking distance, so the hotel does earn some points for that. Overall though, I've stayed at The Arc Hotel in Ottawa for $150 and the room was just as nice, or I've been to the Sheraton, and the room was just as nice but cheaper at the Sheraton. Basically, I would rate this hotel just "good", but that wasn't an option, and the hotel is better than average, so it left me to rate it with very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Le Westin”
Reviews.Author: tdot888
Reviews.Content: Le Westin is in a great location in Old Montreal. The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful allowing us to check in 3 hours earlier than the normal check in time. The service and food at the restaurant La Gazzette was fresh, tasty and the service was attentive and friendly. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AJCM
Reviews.Content: The Montreal Westin is located on the edge of Old Montreal yet walking distance to the city. Even Mont Royale is only a 40 minute walk. The hotel is clean, well maintained (white duvets, flat screen tvs, etc), and the service excellent. Bath robes and slippers are always a great amenity. Love the Starbucks coffee in the room, but the little machines are never great. A great hotel in the city. Perhaps the best in the 4 star cateogory.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ShShCdn
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on the Traditional King room and booked it for a weekend we were spending in Montreal. We loved the location (right in Old Montreal, easy walk to many great restaurants on Notre Dame, metro stop across the street in the convention centre and we even discovered an underground tunnel you can take all the way to Square Victoria...this was nice as it was -20C while we were there!). The front desk staff was great, very helpful and efficient. The concierge was very helpful in securing us amazing seats for the Habs game one night...although she didn't spend too much time at her desk so you may have to ask around for her. The rooms were immaculate, modern and exactly what we were looking for. The beds are indeed "heavenly"...but because everthing was down-filled it can get a bit warm at night...keep your room on the cooler side to make for a better sleep! Housekeeping does a great job. We only dined at La Gazette for breakfast one morning: it was pricey but good...service was slow, though. Overall, a great hotel...would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: asdaq
Reviews.Content: We booked Westin through Hotwire and got a great rate for 4 adults in 1 room! The room size is extremely spacious and very generously sized for a downtown hotel. The room and facilities were very nice and no complaints on anything. Location-wise it was a 10-15 min walk to old Montreal. I'm not sure how close it was to the subway as we didn't use it but as I understand the subway system in Montreal isn't the best. However, there is Bixi stand right next to the hotel which we used a few times and was very convenient, it costs $5 to rent the bike for a day with a max 30min interval each time. All in all good stay and a great location if you are looking to relax and spend time in old Montreal. However, if you are looking to shop or party then you are better off with a hotel closer to St. Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TheNavs
Reviews.Content: We drove in from Quebec City after a long drive in a light snow storm. Our arrival was pleasant. Valet was helpful, our check in was fast and easy. I like the lighting you see when you drive up. We got a great room facing old town Montreal. The gym and spa seemed nice. The concierge and staff were quite helpful and very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel. The rates were quite decent. Our only problem is with a billing error, which I think will be easily corrected (charged a second night when we had cancelled well before the required cancellation time).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume S
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at Le Westin MontrÃ©al and it was awesome. I had a room in a top floor (20th) with a terrific sight on the city. Heavenly bed, heavenly shower, a quiet place and so well located to discover the city : Le Westin is probably the place to stay in MontrÃ©al, period. Special mention to the gym which is perfect for workouts and it's open 24x7. Regarding breakfast, I recomend you to try the buffet at La Gazette, it will offer you all what you can expect. Last but not least, employees are always at your disposal and do their best to fit your needs and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly and perfectly located hotel with welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Samuel S
Reviews.Content: After an initial hiccup with our room, the staff made sure our stay was relaxing and our needs taken care of. Specific thanks to Marie Pier, Paul and Raymond. Great team, wonderful location and our 5 year old had a ball in the swimming pool. Highly recommended! From a returning visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Montreal - a good starwood option”
Reviews.Author: 2dwell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night this week for work. I have stayed here over the past 3 years a few times. The pool area and gym area is excellent - rooms are fairly basic. Food in the restaurant is decent, yet pricey. The room service was great in the past, but this week I found it cold and subpar...I typically pay 140-200 CA depending on whether on not there is a conference across the street. Not a bad price for those chasing spg points.Free internet - but no free upgrade, despite being a gold member and the place was completely empty! I did notice that the room service 'waiter' added a 2nd tip after reviewing my final bill - but that seemed to be par for the course in Montreal with waiters and cabbies making 'errors' in their favor and assuming one wouldnt challenge them. Mon deau! Overall, I like the hotel and will stay again...for those who want bigger rooms athe homewood suites next store have huge rooms. When I'm not on the company dime, I prefer the W...

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Le Westin Montreal for 3 days in November 2011. Upon arrival we were greeted by the doormen and our luggage promptly taken to the reception area. Our check-in was efficient. We elected to upgrade to a Premium room (additional $30). The room was very clean, modern and stylish. The bedding was comfortable with very good quality linen. The washroom was well-appointed and equipped with a rain shower. The only miss was that supplies (i.e. towels, toiletries etc.) were sufficient for 1 person. Only 1 robe was available. We requested an additional robe and toiletries which was promptly delivered. The concierge and reception attendants were all very helpful in suggesting restaurants, making dinner reservations and providing directions. The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs, close to many quaint, stylish and funky restaurants and bars and a few high end boutiques. With a 15 minute walk we were in the main shopping area of Montreal. The exercise facility was very well equipped with free weights, stairmasters, treadmills etc. The glass floored pool was fun. Another miss: although the bottled water provided in the room was noted as complimentary, charges appeared on our bill upon check-out. We requested that the charges be removed and they were. We had also requested that our bill be sent to us via email. Upon arrival back home we received an updated bill with the bottled water charges reappearing. A quick phone call to the hotel cleared that up. Overall a very pleasant stay in a very good quality hotel that provides very efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Lee_C_B_TO
Reviews.Content: Westin is easily our favorite brand for SPG, and the newish Montreal location is no exception! Easily one of of my favorite if not most favorite hotels in the City! Recommended, especially if rate is under $250.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - comfortable, clean and classy.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 3 nights in November. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by both the doormen and reception. There was some confusion at check in about room allocation (party of 4 traveling with two seperate twin rooms) but eventually was sorted as to who was in which room. We were upgraded from a standard double to a junior suite on the 20th floor. Lobby was beautiful, modern with great artwork. Handy info screens displaying flight details in and out of Montreal airport. The room was very generously sized. Junior suite included an entrance room with flat screen TV, couch, chair, coffee table and full length mirror. After walking through this room you were in the main bedroom, with another large full size mirror, wardrobe with safe and robes, another large flat screen TV, drawers and working desk in nice dark wood, another mirror above desk, two lounge chairs in front of gorgeous big window, two queen sized beds and the beautiful large bathroom. Our friends who were in the standard double room had an exact same room of generous size, comfort and standard - only difference was the extra entrance lounge room in the suite. There was no mini bar and the fridge was empty, something I really apprecaited. Of course you could call up and ask for mini bar items, the list and prices were supplied, however I much prefer having an empty fridge for my own items to be stored. View from the room was lovely, overlooking the rooftops of Old Montreal and the river - just gorgeous at sunset. The beds - AMAZING. soooo comfortable and with black out curtains, you could sleep for days! The bathroom - just gorgeous, spacious, heavenly shower certainly was just that with the two shower heads you could adjust to suit and so much room. Cleanliness of the whole room was exceptional. No dust anywhere at all, really noticed how clean and well kept everything was. The decor as well was modern, sleek and calming. Just loved it. Free wifi included with room worked perfectly the whole stay. Room service tasted fine, service from everyone in the hotel was lovely. Courtesy calls to ensure our stay was going well and if there was anything we required. We asked for concierge to recommend a hair salon as we were there for a wedding and they organised and booked with someone local, that was just fabulous. Also asked for info re: where to dine, etc and they were great in providing maps and information for us. Location - it is in the business end of town, near Old Montreal. So very easy access through the hotel to Old Montreal which is a gorgeous part of the city to wander around. If you are looking for shopping, restaurants then it is a bit of a walk to the main streets, however only approx 10 minutes, so over all a good location. Gym facilities were excellent, one of the biggest and most modern gym areas in a hotel I have seen with comp water, plenty of machines and a great view! Upon arriving home received thank you email and survey to complete to provide feedback on our stay, which was welcomed and continued the theme that this hotel really makes you feel like they care about the individual and their time at the property. The whole party who stayed here loved this hotel and I would certainly stay here again and recommend to others when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Winter Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelkimba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Westin for a week in early December and had a wonderful overall experience. The room was large and well fitted with views of the convention center across the street. The hotel is typical of the Westin; well appointed, modern, corporate. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The internet speed and connection wasn't the best and we had a few issues with our password not working. However, seeing that the wireless is complementary, we found it to be acceptable. The hotel location was good, although still a bit of a walk to Old Montreal and at least a 10 minute walk to most cafes and shops. Many of the local cafes and restaurants close on the weekend (as the area is primarily business oriented). The metro stop was only a few steps from the hotel, which was convenient. The hotel bar, Gazette, was decent for cocktails, but the food was ordinary (not fresh) and overpriced. The bar was generally filled with business guests or the after work crowd. Room service was to be expected. Overall, we had a good experience and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Poppy2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of November, upon arrival we were greeted and check in swiftly. The room was lovely - on the 15th Floor very modern and comfortable. Free wifi was included in the rate, which was a great benefit. The location was fantastic near the old town and within walking distance of all the attractions of Montreal. I would recommend taking a trip to Quebec, we took the train from the central station which took 3 hours 20 mins each way, but was so well worth it, for a fantastic day out. I would highly recommend the hotel and its location, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KeroroGunso
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner room. Beautiful with floor to ceiling windows. Large bathroom. Well appointed, modern, chic. Great internet speeds with wired connection. Nice large gym. Location is good. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Westin but overpaid...”
Reviews.Author: petzy1
Reviews.Content: I definitely had a much better overall value in my previous Montreal stay, however Le Westin was a nice place. It seemed new inside and was clean and the bathroom products were nice, It is close to Old Montreal (5 minute walk barely) which was great - also right beside a Metro stop and that was also great as my hubby and I take the subway when in Montreal. There is not much going on directly outside the hotel - you need to walk a few minutes to see anything of interest... but overall it was a good hotel for sure. I think I overpaid though as there was much cheaper rates listed when I went there and I have paid less for nicer places... just timing I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Le Westin Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: A N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband last weekend and I enjoyed my stay. Room- We asked for a room away from elevator and given room in te 12th floor. It was quiet and nice room. We did not hear the elevator or noise from streets below. Room was large with one king size bed. The wash room had big shower and small countertop but it was enough for us. Lobby- I would have preferred more seats in the lobby.It kind of felt too big with few seats. Pool- We saw the pool and fitness centre and did not get a chance to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with the kids in Old Mtl”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: We took two adjoining rooms at the Westin for a long weekend. As usual with the Westin, the beds were wonderful. Breakfast was also quite good, although the service was slow. My only negative comments is that this is a bog hotel with two towers of rooms. The get from the front door to our rooms was quite a hike. Beware. Also the pool is simply not big enough for the number of rooms. But it's well located and the beds are heavenly !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great full-size hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidatTarget
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while on a business trip. This hotel is in a great location at the edge of the old city with both highway (Hwy 720) and metro access. The service was very good/excellent with all staff (front desk, concierge & restaurant) offering high levels of customer service. The stay started with a recessed auto entry (partial glass) that kept us dry from the evening rain, quick & efficient check-in, and a great high level room with an awesome city view. The room was spacious and well-appointed with a large, full-size bathroom (shower only). The stay finished with an awesome breakfast buffet - great, full-strength coffee; fresh OJ; full buffet - hot food, cereals (regular, oatmeal, granola), fresh fruit, montreal bagels, fresh baked goods, cheese, smoked salmon, charcuterie). I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, had better, had worse”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy B
Reviews.Content: Nice location. A bit pricey for bare bones but overall okay. It would have been nice to be informed upon check-in that there was a link below the hotel to the underground world of Montreal. We did not find this out until we found it by accident on our own on our last night there. Room service was barely a passing grade. When I called to ask about one of the desserts that was clearly not what the menu stated, I was told I would get a call back but I did not hear from anyone nor did they send up what I should have received in the first place. Pricey for small portions (tasty main courses) but typical of a higher end hotel. The bed was comfortable and the rooms (we had two) were fine for size. We used airmiles for one room and paid for the other. One problem we had was that they would clean one room and leave the adjoining room dirty for hours (until 4 or 5), even though the door between the two was open. Made for an inconvenience when we came back to get ready for the evening. This was fixed quickly the first day but then repeated the rest of the stay. Most of the staff was friendly but some were a little standoff-ish. Twice we asked opinions on family friendly restaurants but were guided to expensive classier ones. My best advice.....research on your own. Easy walk to Old Montreal and shopping on St. Catherine. Definately have my favourite of all time shampoo, conditioner, lotion etc. I would have liked to have purchased some there but they didn't have the shampoo or conditioner and there is a shipping fee online.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Westin Montreal”
Reviews.Author: akkrn1979
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a work conference the week of October 16. Many people from the conference stayed at the Hyatt. I was very happy that I chose Le Westin! The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. The bed was very comfortable. The walk in shower was perfect. I had no problems with check-in/ check out, everything went very smoothly. The only minor incident was the alarm clock radio was broken. Maintenance came within 10 minutes with a new one. The issue was resolved immediately. The hotel is within walking distance of Old Montreal, the Basillique Cathedral Notre Dame, Chinatown, the Plaza de Artes, and the Downtown. There are many nice restaurants and coffee shops near by. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: sats4eva
Reviews.Content: Im not sure this hotel understands customer service. Day one no house keeping, day two they messed up our food order and it took them 2 hrs to rectify the in room service. Also what was supposed to be a 10 to 15 min wait for our "valet" car, took 45 min. Also the waitess in the gazette dropped our food and we had to wait another 20 min. Day 3 room service said they will be there in 5 min, took them 2 hrs. They just don't understand service.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard Westin”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large, most comfortable beds of most other chains. Easy and fast check in and out, close to everything. BUT the walls are thin. Why can't a chain this big put in better sound proofing? I had a lovely second hand experience of a dance-sex party next door which kept me up one night. Although I eventually called the front desk, I'm not entirely convinced that they actually dealt with it. I can tolerate almost anything, but the dance music vibrating through the walls at 4:30 am is intolerable. The other nights were, thankfully, mute.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business but very few rooms have bathtubs - not great for a family.”
Reviews.Author: MCGKingston
Reviews.Content: I just finished 3 nights at the Westin Montreal for a conference. I have no major complaints about my stay, really. The service was fine, but not exceptional. The room was spacious, and the bed was nice. The wireless was free (nice) but only so-so in terms of reliability (I was on the 12th floor - a factor?) It was a great location across the street from the conference centre. I did not use the pool or exercise facilities, so I can't comment. I did not use the restaurant or room service, or parking. However, I was very surprised to arrive in my room and find only a shower - Heavenly or otherwise. When I booked through the conference website, this was not made clear. I've almost never booked into a $200+ hotel and not had a bath - the only time was when I could only get an accessible room and it was clear when I was booking, and it didn't matter to me. On this trip, this was a minor frustration (yes, I could have asked for a new room, but this would have been a nuisance), but if my 3.5 year old son had been with me (the original plan) this would have been a disaster, as he's still terrified of showers and a bath is part of his bedtime routine, as it is the case for many, many kids. I gather the Westin folks feel big showers are preferred but I really think it needs to be clearer - I read the fine print of my confirmation email (received almost a month after I booked) and I see it's alluded to there, but it's not totally obvious. I'm sure we are not the only ones with small children for whom this would be an issue. I would have appreciated it to be highlighted, as I think it's reasonably unusual, based on our staying in hotels 6+ times per year for business and pleasure. If only 10% of the rooms have baths, I could also see some issues with getting such a room if folks didn't know in advance. I am not sure I'll be back, to be honest, and I would never stay here with my family, in case we could not get a bathtub room for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “these people work well”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: I have not been in such a good hotel in a long time. Obviously the property is wonderful, in front of the Palais des Congres and in between the Intercontinental ad the Embassy Suites. They take 10 minutes for a room service order, they call you by your name, customer service is great. the food is wonderful. They even manage to do their best so you can rent a car when you lost your driving licence. The front desk people are so special. There is Idil and surtout Nadine Pineault. She is so friendly and kind. I stayed there with my daughter in a wheelchair a few days ago and actually I am going back in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Starwood property--some merits, many detractions, not worth price”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: I have to echo another recent review--this Westin is not worth the price of admission. Unless I were returning to Montreal for a convention/meeting at this hotel or across the street, I would not likely return to this property. For the price I eventually paid after upgrades, I would also have been much happier at one of the boutique properties nearby in Vieux Montreal. I am a SPG Gold member, so I am entitled to a room upgrade upon availability. Hoping to get a Club Floor room, I upgraded to a premium room at reservation time for an extra $30/night. At check-in, I was told I could not be further upgraded--Club upgrades were limited to SPG Platinum members. So, my three night stay I paid for an upgrade to a better room which I would have received at no cost otherwise. I asked about the cost to upgrade to Club Floor, and forked over an extra $60/night to do so. So, from an original CAA/AAA rate of $175/night, I paid $265/night for a room and service in a hotel which was lackluster. As a previous reviewer described, the premium room was unappealing. It was a 1-bedroom suite, but the living room had no windows and therefore we never utilized that room. The bedroom was average size in my opinion--probably smaller than the standard size bedrooms elsewhere in the hotel because of the space taken away to create the separate enclosed living room. Bathroom was nice enough, but lacked a bathtub in which I would have enjoyed soaking during this stay. Hotel was very quiet and empty during the three-night stay (Sun-Wed). As a busy conference hotel, it might be fine, but even when empty we felt the hotel was impersonal and we were anonymous as guests (even though our faces were familiar to some of the staff day after day). Location was convenient to Vieux Montreal and to downtown areas--probably the best merit of the property. Club floor privileges were a complete waste of money and rather pathetic. The Club Lounge is essentially defunct. Except for cold beverages available in the refrigerators in the Lounge, there was no other food/beverage service available in the lounge. For breakfast, everyone is sent to the restaurant on the ground floor. Buffet breakfast there was merely adequate. We ate each morning around 9:30 a.m. and consistently found the hot foods barely warm if even warm. Food quality and variety wasn't anything exceptional either, with the noted exception of very good croissants. I certainly wouldn't want to pay $21+ for the buffet otherwise. From 5-7 p.m., you can return to the ground floor restaurant/bar for either tapas or a glass of wine/beer (take your pick) with the SPG coupon provided. The crab cakes we ordered one night were awful. The calamari was fine, as was the coconut shrimp. The only thing that lived up to Starwood expectation, in my opinion, was the typical Starwood quality bed/mattress which provided a comfortable night sleep--that is once we removed all feather products from the bedroom! Otherwise, this was a completely forgettable, albeit expensive, hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: PoppyToronto
Reviews.Content: Planned a weekend away with my husband. Certain photos showed beautiful views of hotel which made it appear as transformed old building into new hotel (not the case in reality). Hotel was just average. Great location...old Montreal through back doors and new Montreal out front doors. We upgraded room...not worth it at all! Would have been better staying at boutique hotel for same cost. Room had no character and had strange layout. We opted out of maid service because we were only there 2 nights but they still came. Will never pay this much again for a chain hotel. My husband doesn't sleep well at most hotels so we thought the heavenly bed would make it better. Had better experience at smaller boutique hotel. Staff was very pleasant and helpful and valet parking was prompt. This still does not justify the cost and we used our AAA card to get the reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Trvlbug49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pleased to get a good deal on this property through Hotwire. We had a king-sized heavenly bed (and it was heavenly) and also enjoyed the heavenly shower. The room was very clean and had lovely amenities including Starbucks coffee and paraben-free shampoo. We slept like a dream and not a sound could be heard..actually I slept better here than at home! The hotel pool was small but there appeared to be two small hot tubs/jacuzzis adjacent, which was a nice touch. Large work-out facility and I enjoyed using the treadmill with the TV. I did not mind that this is a business hotel because it was clean, super comfortable, and pretty classy. The location is sandwiched between Old Montreal and Chinatown, which is perfect for tourists. All hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Need a better club lounge!!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times for work. I do enjoy staying there because 1). the location is excellent, 2). the rooms very spacious and clean, 3). the staff are very friendly and helpful. But.....their club lounge has got to change. There is no food or alcohol served there! It does not feel like a lounge when you are inside. One time I recommended this hotel to a business company who was looking for a hotel to host a meeting. The company ended up booking 20 rooms and I was in one of them. I asked a front desk staff whether I would get a stay credit given that it's a group booking. I was reassured that I would (but I won't get any points which was fine by me). When I checked out, I asked the staff to make sure I will stay the stay credit and she said yes!! Of course the credit was not applied. I called the starwood platinum line and was told that because it's a group booking, I had to call the hotel to sort out the credit. I called the hotel and the staff told me she would get someone to call me back. A week later, no one called me and I called the hotel again to leave another message. Once again, I did not receive any replies. I then wrote an email through their hotel website and again I heard nothing. I figure that it's really not worth spending more time to get the stay credit! I wish someone would be more responsive on their end! Disappointing indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking, some crumbs and a heavenly bed”
Reviews.Author: imari96
Reviews.Content: Oh the small things that added up to annoy me with this hotel! So let's start with those. The lobby was smaller than I expected and strangely laid out to me. The layout was off center, and there wasn't alot of space so when it was crowded - it felt really crowded. Nothing that detracted from my experience. But now add in that I felt some other things were also off given that this is a Westin. There were stains on the carpets and at the bottom of the bed. I happened to eat lunch in the restaurant after brunch. Crumbs were everywhere. Dishes were still out. A few flies were joining me for lunch. Annoying right. Whatever about the flies but the whole time I sat there, I didn't see anyone take out a carpet cleaner to get up the crumbs. And finally - I wasn't a fan of the bathroom layout. The door was extra large and when opened into the bathroom, caused me to have to stand slightly off center from the sink. Oh wait - they charged me for valet parking when I didn't even bring a car. Sure they corrected it right away. So that's it for the annoying. Otherwise, the staff were friendly enough. I got to check out late which I loved. The bed - of course - wonderful! Spacious room. I though the location was ok - it's center but that just means you walk 10 mins to get to some action. Work was paying this time, so if work wanted to pay again - I'd stay here. If it was my own wallet, it's possible I'd consider another spot just to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: pure b
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 night in the le Westin Montreal. The room was clean, modern, spacious and the bed was so comfortable. I was so impressed with the service and concierge. Location is close to old montreal and the major shopping area. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Paris
Reviews.Content: Good location for visits to the vieux Montreal and to the nearby metro station. Great staff and nice evening cocktail (though wine limited only to 1 glass..), the tapas are delicious! Clean plates would well be appreciated at the buffet breakfast though for a hotel of this standing!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: guybeachbum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is/was relatively new, and as such, the rooms and hotel are in great condition. The rooms are well appointed and very spacious. The amenities, including the pool with glass bottom, are great. The lobby bar/restaurant is a nice place to have a drink at the end of the day. I terms of location, it is a short jaunt to Old Montreal, and maybe 10min or so to the shopping on rue Ste. Catharine. The staff are very pleasant and were more than accommodating with the one or two requests that I had. I would be happy to stay here again! Tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: likebeingatourist
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights at Le Westin while in Montreal on business. The location is excellent with easy access to old Montreal and the great restaurants to be found there. Found the room nicely decorated with a very calming colour palette and the bed & pillows were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was great with a spacious shower but I did miss having a bathtub. Found the service was very good from the bellstaff/valet to the front desk to the bar/restaurant. Overall a great hotel and I would stay there again if in Montreal for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: nycwiz
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very clean. Good service. Fitness center is excellent for a hotel. I just wished the restaurant/bar was more happening, perhaps, If they offered a free drink for SPG members they may get more people to come and spend more money. I love the cold and hot tub. I can leave without the valet parking, but other hotels charge the same anyway. Free WiFi is also great. Most views of this hotel face another building. Other than this i would give 5 star. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, new, modern and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: Seanmage
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here for a series of business meetings. The location is excellent for access to old and new Montreal and within easy walking distance to restaurants and entertainment. The room was sparse and efficient and everything worked the way I like it for business trips as I do not spend time in the room. Very good service and food during all meetings. Thank you to your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: htsantsoulas
Reviews.Content: Our group of four stayed at the Westin hotel in the old port district of Montreal for a fabulous "girls weekend" this summer. The location of the hotel was perfect for our plans - everything we wanted to do was within walking distance. The staff was friendly and accomodating, and the room was clean and spacious. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 914Familyof4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin. Our room didn't have much of a view but was very large -- two double beds and a nice sitting area. The room was clean, except for a few Swedish Fish left over from the prior guests. The food at the restaurant was excellent although we found the service a little slow. The location was convenient to the subway and Old Montreal and the concierge was very helpful with finding things to do with the kids. Also, the kids loved the glass bottomed pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer and Better Location of All SPG Properties”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRocky
Reviews.Content: It is a nice and clean Westin located very central to shopping district and across Palais de Congress Center. If you have good corporate rate, not too expensive and nice breakfast is included. Found WiFii Signals were quite weak throughout the stay and watch out as you may get billed for smoking after departure although one doesn't even smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Rooms, Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: pmohanram
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in early July. The rooms are great, spacious with nice bathrooms. I love the fact that they reward you with bonus points if you choose not to have your room serviced daily. The location is lovely - close to both Old Montreal as well as downtown Montreal. It is barely 5 minutes walking to the Notre dame church and the rest of old Montreal. I did not eat at the hotel - but our conference lunches, catered by the hotel, were uniformly excellent. I also did not use the pool, which has a glass bottom that opens up over the lobby entrance - nice but kind of weird.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: skippy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin over Labor Day weekend and stayed in an executive club room on the top floor. I had expected it to be a nicer room, but looking at the website, it's merely a traditional room with a few added amenities. The view was spectacular. The housekeeping could use some work. One day, no hand towels. The next day, no cups. We had access to the executive club which consists of a room with tables and chairs, refrigerator with free drinks and some fruit. It was nice to be able to get sodas and extra water. The website states that breakfast is served there, but you need to go to the restaurant. Now for the restaurant. Wonderful. Breakfast was nice, a great assortment of everything from lox and bagels, to eggs, to cereal and everything in between. We ended up eating dinner at the restaurant twice during our stay and I had two wonderful meals. The lobster risotto was excellent. Now, the location. The location of the hotel can't be beat. A quick walk to the old city out the back and a quick walk to some major shopping out the front. I also want to recommend your taking a boat ride. Go down to the port and pick whichever one appeals to you. We did and had so much fun. All in all, the Westin was the right hotel to choose and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient, Safe, Easy to get to and from”
Reviews.Author: ROBERTLOUISSTEVENSON
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from everything: waterfront, old city, entertainment, subway, etc. Very clean, and very easy; everything the brand denotes. I've stayed here three times, and every time it was a great value. A modern hotel, so not allot of old world charm, but the concierges were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Le Westin Montreal and would go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: Itsus13
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just stayed at the Le Westin Montreal for the Labour Day long weekend. We justed loved the atmosphere and service. The hotel is so well located. The front door is right in downtown Montreal and the back door is just steps away to Old Montreal. We walked for most of our stay and then rented the Bixi Bikes right outside the front door of the hotel. Our room was very spacious, very clean and well appointed. We thought the linen was of very good quailty and a pleasure to sleep on those 'Heavenly Beds.' We had breakfast in beautiful restaurant and really enjoyed the fresh fruit and the excellent selections of hot food on the buffett. Next time we are in Montreal, we are booking in at the Le Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location by Vieux Port”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: I decided to try to stay by this area. I recommend this place for business, not really for family. This area was bit sketchy at night. I didn't feel comfortable walking my dog after midnight. They did do a good job renovating this hotel. Valet was efficient and front desk was very friendly. Good location to restaurants and cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and amenities - but the staff could be a little friendlier”
Reviews.Author: chicke11
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Montreal and our first stay at Le Westin Montreal. There were 4 adults and 2 young children (ages 3 and 4) in our party. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to Old Montreal many of the sites and attractions. The Rooms We stayed in rooms 837 and 838 in the St. Jacques tower, each room with 2 queen beds. The rooms were fairly spacious, clean, and had good amenities. There was no view per se, but the rooms did get good natural light, and were soundproof. My in-laws staying in the room next door said that they did not hear our two boys making any noise at all. The bathroom had a huge shower (no bathtub), good water pressure, and the level of luxury that we have come to expect from the Westin brand. The beds were comfortable, albeit with feather pillows that were a tad too soft, and the sheets were crisp and clean. Every day when we returned from a day of sight seeing, the rooms were immaculately made. The WiFi connection was fast and included in the room rate. The Pool There is an indoor swimming pool - one main pool and two smaller plunge pools with hot and cold water. The main pool wasn't tremendously big, but it was big enough for my 3 and 4 year olds. The pool area had high ceilings, lots of natural light, and plenty of floaties for the boys. Food - Breakfast/Room Service We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant each morning. Buffet breakfast was included in our room rate for the adults, and kids ate for free as they were under the age of 5. There was a decent selection of hot and cold foods, lots of cereal, and plenty of fresh fruit. Service was always excellent. We also ordered room service for one dinner during our trip. It took about 30 minutes for the food to arrive. Selection was OK, and the food quality/quantity was pretty good for room service. Concierge/Check-in/Check-out/Valet We booked our hop on/hop off bus tour through the concierge (kids under age 5 were again free). Likewise, check-in and check-out was smooth and seamless. The valets were also very fast about bringing up our car, and when my boys accidentally left their toys behind in the vehicle, they gladly went down to the parking garage and brought up the wayward toys. The only thing that this hotel needs to work on is the friendliness of the staff. to be clear, no one was outright rude. In fact, everyone was quite helpful in terms of performing their job function when we approached them. But no one ever said "good morning" or "bon matin" to us until I said it to them first. Now, I'm a brusque New Yorker, so this didn't really bother me. But I have stayed at many luxury establishments throughout the world, and I can say for certain that an unprompted smile or a nod from the staff would have earned this hotel a higher rating in this review.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: THEPOW
Reviews.Content: .A very well run Westin property located on the edge of the central business district while very close to the old town as well as China town. We drove in and left the car parked for our entire 4 night stay [at $23 per day but little alternative] The Metro is very close, easy to use, and goes almost everywhere. Rooms are large, beds are great, shower is wonderful and entire property is spotless. We did not use their restaurant but it looked very nice from the outside looking in. Shop a bit for the best price as they offer a wide selection of rooms and price points plus packages. You will remember the quality long after the price is forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaronDon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin for a long weekend at the end of August using cash and Starwood points. We stayed in the St. Jacques tower on a high floor, but we didn't have any views to speak of. The room was nice, but the layout was a bit weird as we had a hallway (of what I consider wasted space) leading into the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable and the free refrigerator and wi-fi was much appreciated. The best part for us was the location. We are big walkers and we were able to take the back exit to enter Old Montreal quickly or head out the front for a walk to the downtown area. Additionally, it is near some metro stops and on a rainy day, we were able to walk around using the in-house entrance to the underground tunnels. The valet service was a bit spotty and there were a couple of times where we had to go into the hotel to ask them to send someone out (this was mainly late at night). Concierges were helpful with any questions we had. Overall, a nice hotel which I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: stepdam002
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Hotwire and got a good deal on the room. The hotel is new and is beautifully appointed. We would highly recommend the hotel. The gym and pool area is excellent - the pool has a glass bottom - very special. The gym has top of the line equipment. The room itself was perfect. The best sleep on the most comfy bed and pillw. Service was also top notch. The restaurant/bar (The Gazette) was nicely done and service was very welcoming. The only downside was the inital impression left by the valets and the front desk. French first and a little snooty. We met friendlier people later in our stay but the initial impression was not as welcoming as it should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place.”
Reviews.Author: ruthe70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a girls 40th birthday weekend and it was just perfect. The staff were so nice, the facilities were second to none. Only did room and breakfast but the breakfast was delicious! As a relatively new hotel, they could have faltered but everything was delightful. Perfect location for experiencing all that Old Montreal has to offer, as within walking distance of most restaurants and bars. I am not a coffee drinker, but my friend loved the Starbucks coffee in the room, it made her day!

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel, but "Executive Club" is a joke”
Reviews.Author: Be_devine
Reviews.Content: Beware booking an "Executive Club" room. Advertised: "Spectacular View." Reality: Although on the top two floors, many of the Executive Club rooms face a brick wall of the building across the street and have no view at all, much less a spectacular one. Advertised: "Access To Executive Lounge. Reality: The "Executive Lounge" has no service at all. It's basically just an empty suite. No food service at any time of day, and just a refrigerator with a few drinks in it. It's pretty depressing. Advertised: Evening Hors D'oeuvres Reality: They give you a coupon for either one tapas OR one glass of wine in the restaurant. The rooms are very poorly insulated. We were not adjacent to the elevators, but could hear the elevators "whooshing" all night. You also could hear the pipes creaking whenever someone next to or above you used any water. In general, the hotel is fine. It's a typical sterile business hotel surrounded by hotels with much more charm. I've also stayed at the St. James, right across the street, and the Place de Armes, down the street one block, and I would recommend looking at one of these hotels before paying the price for the Executive Club. The location is great, and the neighborhood is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bed, loved the bathroom lighting!”
Reviews.Author: ditchchamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and got a great price online. It was a perfect 4 star... wonderful feel but no 'extras'. We asked for champagne flutes and an ice bucket shortly after arriving, and they were delivered to our room within minutes. The bed and sheets were amazing. Loved the iPod dock by the bed. My favourite part was the mirrors and lighting in the bathroom... gorgeous, and perfect for applying makeup!! The only problem was the valet parking... between 11 pm and 1 am we could not find ANYONE at the valet station, and had to go into the hotel and ask random workers for our car at 11 pm and then had to leave our keys at the front desk when we returned. I would like someone full time right there. But once we did ask for our car, they brought it out within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to most everything”
Reviews.Author: love2trave09
Reviews.Content: This Westin is a large, modern hotel. Located across from the Palais des Congres (convention center), it is near the metro, a short walk from Vieux-Montreal and the cathedral, and not too far from the main shopping area and University McGill, for those who like to walk. (It took us an hour to walk to the main overlook in Parc du Mont-Royal.) Our room was large and clean, and the bathroom had plenty of towels, but I did have to phone for another robe, since they only put one in the closet. (I understand that many travel alone, but if you are registered as two people in a room, then it should follow that two robes are left on the day of check-in.) The bed was very comfortable, and with the blackout curtains, made for a wonderful night sleep. The couch and chair were hard and not very comfortable; the cushions were made of some fabric that kept with the modern theme, but was rough and too firm. There was an in-room safe, which was located in a cabinet down by the floor. Not only did that make it inconvenient, but it was very hard to see the instructions and numbers. The hotel has a bar/restaurant that serves meals, but you should go into Old Montreal to Olive and Gourmando or to other near-by espresso and salad shops, rather than eat in what is really their bar. However, it was nice for a drink before heading out to dinner, and to watch some sports on TV. The staff was friendly and helpful when approached with questions, but there was no information in the room to help tourist types figure out the best way to tackle the city. There is a museum and travel ticket which saves a lot of money for families who are in the area for a few days...but you need to ask. Montreal is a great place to explore for a few days, and the Westin is a good choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great room”
Reviews.Author: drmtbc
Reviews.Content: My company has discount rates at 3 fine hotels in downtown Montreal - I randomly selected this one over the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth and the Sheraton Centre, and was delighted I did! It is literally on the boundary of old Montreal (exit via the back door) and downtown Montreal (exit via the front door). We stayed in the Saint Jacques Tower. This hotel tower has a fantastic layout - it has an all-floor atrium right in the middle, with the rooms on each floor laid out around the atrium like a ring. This made our room feel like it was in its own wing, and was super quiet. Staff were helpful, the room felt brand new and was wonderfully appointed with 2 large beds, a mini fridge, safe, and wireless. We had a view of the river, and the metro was in the building complex across the street. Breakfast in the hotel was delish but pricey, so we walked 50 feet up the corner to Eggspectations where we had yummy breakfasts and lunch. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to beautiful Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Laptop stolen”
Reviews.Author: 8Track
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and for nearly 20 years have never had anything stolen from my room. That changed in Le Westin while I was out on a tour of the city. The management's reaction to my report was far less sympathetic than one would hope. They suggested that it was impossible because the keh card reader showed only ome entrant to the room -- me. Unfortunately, the logged time of entry was 40 minutes before I returned. So, I felt accused of lying about the incident. They were quite surprised I persisyed and expressed desire to file a police report, as futile as that gesture might be. End verdict for me -- loss of confidence in the hotel and maybe the brand too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: LajaVirginia
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Westin with our 2 children (ages 11 and 14). This hotel is extraordinary. The staff at each step (front desk, concierge, room service, housekeeping, restaurant) couldn't have been more friendly (yet professional) and helpful. We moved to the Westin after a one night bad experience at another hotel up the street. What a difference! The woman who helped us had a bellman show us several different rooms to help us decide on the best configuration for our family. We chose connecting rooms. The rooms were very large, clean, well decorated, and quiet. The bathrooms were also very nice, and well equipped. The beds were extremely comfortable with excellent quality bedding. We didn't have a view, but if that's important to you, I believe there are "premium rooms" on higher floors that do have views. Our children really enjoyed the pool -- especially the windows at the bottom of the pool that look out to the front of the hotel. The staff at the concierge desk deserve specific mention. They were so helpful. Their advice on everything we asked about was excellent. All of their restaurant recommendations were perfect for us, and they were very helpful in planning our day at La Ronde. (You can buy tickets at the concierge desk.) The hotel location is terrific. It's a 1-2 block walk to Old Montreal, and an easy walk to downtown, too. We would definitely stay here again if we're back in Montreal, and highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_613
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently on business and would not stay anywhere else. The staff is very courteous and the hotel amazing.

Reviews.Title: “one night of luxury”
Reviews.Author: traveltdot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way back from driving from NS. After sleeping on a not so great double bed for 10 days we both agreed a nice king bed would be fun. We booked through Hotwire the day of check in for $ 159 including taxes. Not a great rate, but not the worst either. Cheaper through hotwire than calling the hotel directly for some reason. Check in was easy and fast. The room was beautifully furnished and clean and our bed very comfortable. Shower only so if you want a bath I think you need to request it. However the shower was wonderful. Even though the hotel was great, beware they do charge you for every little thing in this hotel. We ordered a glass of wine through room service. They charged us $ 4 for the room service so I am not sure if tipping is actually necessary?? With taxes and service charges one glass of red wine cost us $20. Valet parking was $25. With a couple of coffees our bill was over $200. All the little things can add up but we were happy with our stay here. Very central location, can walk to Old Montreal in less than five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, Expensive Add-ons, inconvenient all around”
Reviews.Author: Buchans79
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, decent air conditioning. But the hotel itself is located in a maze of one way streets and is difficult to see until you are almost upon it. Street adddress does not work well in GPS. Parking is excessively expensive, as are uses of services like business centre. Everything beyond room costs more - including things that would often be complimentary in comparable hotel. Rooms are oddly shaped - much space wasted near the entrance and then a small space near where you enter the functional part of the room. Also, there is a convoluted means of getting to the room - escallator, elevator, then stairs, twisting and winding around the hotel. The hotel is poorly laid out and many staff gave poor directions as to where things were in the hotel (ie the expensive business centre from which I am typing this review). All in all, not even worth the discounted rate we managed to get through a blind-bid discount sight. Certainly NOT worth full regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed in in Mtl so far!”
Reviews.Author: LBinDC1
Reviews.Content: Basically, I have nothing but praise for this property, and its staff. We were greeted warmly upon arrival, offered an upgrade as Starwood Platinum members & even offered the late check-out if needed. While these are platinum benefits, my experience at other properties is that these are offered grudgingly, if at all, and usually offered as a favor/exception rather than as an earned reward. The Westin itself is conveniently located, has been recently refurbished, rooms (well, the one we had) are large and sunny, a/c worked perfectly, everything was modern and the club room was well stocked at all times. The hotel gym is really nice with a variety of equipment (unusual for most hotels) although the pool was small, and filled with loud kids, not really inviting for most hotel guests, I'm sure. Breakfast (included as a platinum reward) was wonderful, even for a health nut like myself. Finally, quick tip for visitors to this wonderful city. Use the bike share - there are lots of stations all over the city, it's relatively inexpensive, and a great way to see the city during the pleasant summer months. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Westin and Love Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: kiki_caprice
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - it was walking distance to alot of things (great restaurants and shops, etc). The rooms were comfy, and the concierge was great. I will say that the hotel was kind of hard to find, it's not quite as tall as others, and the signage is not quite as readable, especially when driving into Montreal at 10pm at night.
