Overall, a great time! PS. there's a starbucks nearby - for those who need a pick me up, first thing in the morning... (wish I could give 4.5 stars - only b/c it was initially hard to find)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old Montreal, walking distance to most of the attractions. Check-in was a bit slow and there was also a line up. As a starwood preferred guest, we were put on a SPG floor which was nice. Glass bottom pool was interesting as you can see it by the entrance. rooms were spacious and bedding was comfortable. Concierge was slightly helpful, again, long wait and sometimes no answer. At one point, they did call me back and apologized. Valet service was worth it, the price was reasonable compared to other major cities. It does warn you that you have to wait at least 20 minutes. We never had to wait for our car, once we called, within 15 minutes it was there. Also, there are in and out privileges if needed. woudl definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: Johan E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the brand new Westin Montreal for an extended period of time through June, July and August this year. The staff is awesome, from front desk all the way up to the managers, super nice and accomodating. The service level is just right and if you are looking for that little extra, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms - everything else is questionable”
Reviews.Author: DeepakinToronto
Reviews.Content: Being an SPG Gold member, I have stayed at Westins in 8 different countries. We decided on impulse to go to Montreal for the weekend. The hotel is impressive when you pull in. I went to the SPG Gold and Platinum counter, and had to wait 20 minutes before being served. It was 2:00 PM, and we were told that our rooms weren't ready. I asked for a specific time when the rooms would be ready, only to be told to check back every hour or so, Wow - talsk about obnoxious Montreal service. We finally got one room at 3:45, and were told that the second room would be ready in "a few minutes". I don't know what their definition of "a few minutes" is, but the second room took another hour to be ready. Undoubtedly, the rooms were spectacular. Huge for an urban centre, nicely appointed. Try asking for some extra coffee packets !!!! Had to call 3 times, and it took them 50 minutes to bring 2 coffee packets to the room. In all other Westins around the world, any staff that you encounter while in the hotel politely greet you. Not so at this hotel. They go the extra mile to avoid eye contact. Overall, a gorgeous hotel, as long as you don't have to talk to any staff member. What amazes me is the difference in service levels between this Westin, and say the ones in Vegas, Orlando, Miami, Paris, Rome, and New York. Everywhere else, the staff are friendly. Avoid this hotel if you can. There is a W just round the corner (if you insist on Starwood), or else an Inter-Continental right next door. Or better yet, the Hotel Le St. James a block away (if you want ultimate luxury and beautiful FRETTE linen).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Hinkochi
Reviews.Content: Everything was lovely. The rooms and bathrooms are large, clean, and beautiful. Beds are fabulous. VERY comfortable pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good with some hiccups!”
Reviews.Author: Chitownee
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a child, I often run into many hiccups when it comes to hotel rooms. And Le Westin Montreal was no different, although I was thought to believe that they were on top of things prior to my arrival. I called three times to make sure that we had a crib in our room. You ask "Why did I call three times?" Well, I just didn't trust the people I spoke with. During the third conversation, the woman at the front desk assured me that they would put the crib in our room prior to arrival. That was more than I could have asked for, but it also seemed like they were promising too much by stating that they would do that. When we checked in at the front desk, I reminded them that I needed a crib. The person at the front desk said that she saw the record where I called three times to confirm. And she said "oh I hope that there is one left for you because we are out of cribs." OMG! So she said that we should get one since I called ahead of time so many times and that it should be in our room. Sure enough, we got there and no crib was in the room. I had to call the front desk AGAIN (fifth time) to remind them to bring it up. How annoying! One day when it was raining outside, we called down to get our car. They said ok we will have it out for you and didn't specify a time. After 40 minutes, still no car. It was busy down there, but really? 40 minutes??? So we cancelled the car and walked. When we called to cancel, they made no apologies and just said ok...as if they were relieved that they didn't have to get our car. The room itself was actually very clean and nice. It looked like it had been renovated recently which made for a very comfortable stay. The room size was large even with a crib because I get automatically upgraded because of my status with SPG. Overall, some hiccups but nothing that would stop me from staying here again. Nice location to Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “It really is in the small details.”
Reviews.Author: jandue
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my son's birthday in Montreal and the concierge was more than accommodating. They called the bakery, ordered the cake, had it delivered, and placed it in our room while we took him out for dinner so he could be surprised. They even went out of the way to find candles and matches. All this was done with a smile. It is in very quaint Old Montreal, minutes from the Metro and near a variety of restaurants for the nights you want to stay close. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It. Everyone Was Impressed. Great For A Group Of Friends.”
Reviews.Author: dadarren
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in nicer hotels like this one, but we found a great deal for it on Hotwire.com. A group of friends (20's-30's) stayed here together in one room with two queen beds. We were visiting Montreal for the Diversite festival and we have absolutely no complaints about this hotel! The hotel is in a great downtown location. It's directly beside Montreal's Old City, very close to China Town, and about a 7 minute walk from the popular Rue St Catherine, the main shopping hub of downtown Montreal. The area around the hotel is very clean with a few cute cafes & restaurants. If you're going for a festival like Diversite or Just For Laughs, it's about a 15-25 minute walk to those venues, or a quick taxi ride. In any interaction with hotel staff (check-in, check-out, calling reception for hotel information, etc.), we were provided with prompt, quick, and polite service. Hotel room, washroom, and walk-in shower were all exceptionally clean. The beds were amazingly comfortable. Refridgerator in the room made it easy for us to purchase some of our own items to keep in the room for the weekend. We were told we could even have a microwave brought to the room if we wanted. The room had both wi-fi and direct-connection high-speed internet for free. We simply had to call reception to get a new log-in code every once in a while as it was changed frequently. The indoor pool area was a nice way to relax. It's a small pool mostly for cooling off and refreshing yourself. There is also a hot-tub and cold-tub and a sauna. Hotel has a pool attendant on-hand to provide fresh towels. We all were impressed with the hotel and would stay there again if we could get a reasonable price. We were travelling with Brock from www.backpackwithbrock.com so he may have a feature on the experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: SKingList
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff and location of this property. I'd read some complaints about check in time but we arrived around 1p on a Friday and all was smooth. We were able to get into our room and quickly headed out to explore the city on foot. We also could have taken the metro due to proximity of the Place d'Armes station on the orange line. We ate breakfast daily at the Gazette and the buffet is very high quality. Worth taking advantage of if it's in your room rate. The rooms are of typical Westin quality and everything was up to expectations. I love the current shampoo and conditioner selection. We were upgraded to the Westin Workout Floor and while I didn't get to take advantage of the gym or the pool, both looked great. Love the idea of the glass bottomed pool. The operator responded promptly to minor issues in the room. I received some benefits as SPG member, but also love the specials on the hotel's own site. The Sweet Deal package is a very good one and the benefits are ones that can be used on along weekend without going to waste. There is some confusion among the concierge staff about some of the hotel's offers but overall great service throughout. With its location across from the Palais de Congress and right in the old city, I recommend this for business or leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge and Staff Problems created disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MenOnVacation
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a recent vacation with my mom to show her the city I had already learned to love. I booked the Westin because I expected top quality and excellent concierge services. Unfortunately, on our first day we were given bad information by the concierge that caused us to waste time and miss opportunities. I asked about day tours on the water of the Harbor and to Quebec City. I was told there were none, to my surprise! I pressed the concierge and learned there was a Ferry to the small island where the Biosphere and Casino are located, but that "the Metro was much easier". While I would agree that that the Metro is the best way to see the Biosphere, the information regarding day cruises was completely wrong!! 2 days later we learned that there were 2 day cruises to Quebec City which we had not been told about (one that returns by cruise and includes a visit to the falls on St. Lawrence (!!) , and another that cruises 1-way and returns by bus). However we learned about these too late and were stuck taking the bus which was recommended to us by Westin. The bus was fine... but it was not the tour we wanted and asked about and really wanted. Additionally, we learned too late that there IS an evening cocktail/dinner cruise on a nice River Boat for scenic views of the city which we had not been told about. We also cut our day short on day 2 at the Biosphere (which I HIGHLY recommend) because we were told that there was only 1 light show at 630pm for the Notre Dame cathedral. Not only was this information wrong, since there was a 2nd later show, but the tickets were sold out by the time we got to the cathedral at 6pm at the advice of the Westin. Finally, the cleaning of the room could have been better. The ceiling of our bathroom was splattered with something gross (when we arrived and was never cleaned), and the the tile in the shower was mildewed. The hotel advertises itself as the "newest" luxury hotel in Montreal, but I have a hard time believing this. I will comment that the location is ideal and the staff were all very friendly ... unfortunately though not as knowledgeable as they should have been. I believe they hire interns for the summer from France rather than locals and they do not seem properly trained as local experts to act as a concierge! Finally, I would comment that the fitness center was woefully inadequate and the small pool was completely overrun by children the entire time of my visit. I would probably book the W down the street next time whose concierges I found in previous stays to be absolute professionals!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: WeJalan2
Reviews.Content: Plus points: 1. Swimming pools are unique (although small and can get crowded) with three different temperatures and the glass floor. 2. Rooms are nice. We had a premium and it was really spacious (although the view may be non-existent depending on which floor you get). 3. Centralized location On the not-such a plus side: 1. Service was very disappointing - the room was ready only after 4pm (even though I had asked for early check-in and upon arrival, received the standard response of check-in is at 3pm). Guess what? It was NOT ready at 2.45 or 3.30 or 4pm. The front desk was not able to provide acceptable alternative solutions. Neither did they pre-empt us that there might be delays in checking in and just gave the standard responses of trying to get it ready every time we asked. The manager only stepped in after we had spoken to the front desk four times and insisted to see the manager. 2. Valet parking really takes time so factor that when going out or coming back 3. The lifts have a "security" feature where the guest card is needed but somehow it allows access to other floors as well (not that secure after all?). Guess we also need it to collect ice if we're not on those floors where it's available. Relax? Recharge? I definitely will need to after the "fantastic" service received upon arrival. That really got the trip off to a "good" start.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Masahisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend on our trip to Canada (Toronto-Montreal-Quebec City) and stayed here for a night. The location was perfect for us because most of attractions were within walking distance. Old Montreal was just a few blocks away, and subway station was just across the street (just under the congress building). The staff at the front desk was very professional and prompt. The concierge was very helpful on giving some restaurants ideas. The room was chic and spacious. It was a little disappointing that there was no good view from the window of the room and the room was a bit dark during the day because of the building next to the hotel. The bathroom was clean and spacious as well. Westin's room quality does not always disappoint me and this Westin is as same as other Westin. This was the first time to visit Montreal so I cannot compare with other hotels in downtown Montreal, but overall experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: ecomom13
Reviews.Content: We flew from San Francisco night flight and arrived in Montreal at 7am. We were flying Air Canada...another amazing expreience... I called the hotel and spoke with Bonnie at the front desk. I told her we just flew in from San Francisco and was there any possible way we could check in EARLY...she said of course! She was so pleasant on the phone and when we arrived she was so nice and set us about with our lovely comfortable room! The rooms are spacious and they have great fluffy towels...super beds and a refigerator in case your children need snacks. We were traveling with a 1 and 4 year old. The could't have been nicer! The brought a crib up with adorable little blanket. The valet were super nice and recommeneded a great place to have some lunch in Old Town about a 5 minute walk. The concierge helped us with a restarurant for dinner and breakfast the next day. The pool was AWESOME TOO...glass bottom... very fun! WE woke kind of late and I called in for a late check out and they let us check out at 2pm. WE also stayed at the pool until 3pm...as this kids loved it so much! When we left Bonnie checked us out... She was so nice again and gave our boys a little Westin hat and fun little games and a back pack... We will be staying at Westin's from now on with our family... Thank you Westin Montreal for making the beginning of our Month holiday in Montreal/Europe a super success! cheers...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: desimd
Reviews.Content: Classic Westin. Very comfortable, great service, super rooms. We had a room next to the elevators and were disturbed by some young late-night party animals who decided to have a party next to the elevator! So try to avoid rooms next to elevators. The location is superb for business travelers since it is right next to the convention center. It is also walking distance to most city attractions, including the old city, Chinatown, little Italy and little Portugal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug416
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel is almost perfect in price to serivice & quality ratio. Of course cheper is always nice but I have no complain. The rooms were clean, spacious, updated and comfy. Service was good. Excellent location. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: RogerioF1
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a very good location, close to Montreal Old City. Very good breakfast but very expensive, mainly because it was during the Formula 1 period

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located if you want to visit Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Queensjad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Montreal for our anniversary and a Cirque du Soleil show in the old port. The hotel was very clean and the concierge service, valet parking, and front desk staff were very friendly and on top of things (always around to help, answer your questions, open the doors for you, etc....) Within walking distance to many restaurants, the old port, and shopping! Great location and the indoor pool was pretty neat, too (look up at the roof as you drive up to the front doors)! We got the best price by booking through Hotwire (it was only $130 a night compared to the hotels asking price of $235) That said, I probably would have still paid their full asking price.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay even better than the first stay!”
Reviews.Author: zoeybear108
Reviews.Content: We visited Montreal for the weekend with another couple. We opted for the Club Floor rooms using the birth rate package where one night is regular price and the second and third nights are the price of the last 2 digits of the year you were born. Great deal! We had full buffet breakfast every morning which always stayed open way past the time it was to end. Also was included in the club room complimentary cocktails or appetizers. We had 6 coupons per couple so one night we ordered 4 drinks and 2 appetizers. There is free wifi and complementary water as well as turn down service. Would for sure opt for the Club floor again. But overall the hotel is very nice and well maintained. The staff are super friendly. The rooms are modern and clean. I am super picky and the washroom was great with the heavenly shower with glass shower door, lots of towels and a makeup mirror. I would highly recommend this hotel as there are always deals on the SPG website and the location was great. A 10 minute walk to Old Montreal and 10-15 minutes to St. Catherine's and St Laurent is a good 20 minute or so walk or a $10-$12 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lelake
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location for the Jazz Festival. The hotel was walking distance to the festival, China Town and Old Port. We brought our bikes and biked every day, although Montreal now has bike stations that you can rent bikes at. The room was comfortable, bright and clean and roomy. There is a breakfast if you choose to purchase it, but with Old Port around the corner, go there instead. The fitness area was good. The pool was small, but did its purpose. There are both a cold and hot tub , although only one working jet in the hot tub. The male worker who opens the pool area was late, napped and had no personality. I would stay here again for the location convenience and comparable rates. It is nothing fancy but is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lbk01
Reviews.Content: We booked on Expedia, because the flight was very expensive-the flight and hotel together cost less than the flight alone. FYI there is no airport shuttle-we took a taxi. We were there for an anniversary, and I requested something special for our room. When we arrived we immediately had a delivery of wine and chocolate-covered strawberries, which (to my surprise) were complimentary. My husband had also ordered flowers and the staff was very helpful with this over the phone. The hotel is on the edge of Old Montreal and downtown, so it's great for heading in either direction. We spent a lot of time in Old Montreal and took a taxi or subway to explore other areas. Very nice hotel. I checked out the indoor pool area, which would be the only negative for me-it was small and filled with children. The pool was divided into three sections but two of the sections were ice cold. We were not really interested in swimming anyway, and I guess this would be good if you were traveling with children. Highly recommend Europa for a special occasion dinner. Wonderful trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguru2009
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Westin in Montreal a number of times now for business, and it is my preferred choice. A good location, only a 5-10 minute walk from the heart of Old Montreal for dinners, and large spacious well appointed rooms. The staff are always very polite and have immaculate English. The hotel is very large which can mean a 5-10 minute journey to your room from the reception. I would recommend becoming a member of the Starwood preferred guest program as you can get reduced rates vs. sites like Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Very Clean.”
Reviews.Author: bergk1212
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my fiance because he had a conference. We were very pleased. The location was great and the rooms were immaculate, stylish, and exceptionally clean. The pool was cool because you could look up into it from the entrance. We were wishing that the bar was open a little later but it wasn't too much of a problem because Old Montreal is so close and even closer is the W which has a lounge with great drinks that is open late. Le Westin is an especially great hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel in a good location, but front desk needs to be more organized”
Reviews.Author: u2greek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 2 nights to attend the U2 concert. The hotel is located just on the outskirts of old town, so it is a 15-20 minute walk to several locations to visit including the Old Port, and the shops on St. Catherines. It is also situation close to the Square Victoria Metro Station stop. The hotel is in a fairly quiet area but close enough to places you want to see. Valet (although about $25) and check-in process were quick and seemless. There was also complimentary ice tea for all guests in the lobby area. Right away, you notice that the hotel is only a couple of years old, including the lobby, common areas and guest rooms. The elevators also have an added security of having to use your room key to go to a guest room floor. Our room was clean and quite spacious with 2 comfortable queen size beds as you would expect from a Westin (also, with plenty of pillows). The bathroom was a very nice size including a large shower stall. All they key amenities were in the room, as well as a large flat screen TV. But within a few minutes of being in the room, we noticed a problem that would lead to a couple of other problems during our stay: No cold/cool water in the faucet or shower. The water was only hot and too hot to wash your hands for more than 1-2 seconds, and definitely too hot to take a shower. We called the front desk and they sent a technician right away. By then we were on our way out for a late lunch. Upon returning, we didnt see a note or a message from anyone on whether or not the issue was fixed. We quickly checked the water - and the issue was not resolved. When I went down to the front desk, they immediately offered to switch our room (before I even asked). However, they moved us to a room one floor below almost right below our existing floor. So when we got to that room, the water was still too hot and no cold/cool water was coming out. We eventually left our room to go for dinner and noted the issue again to the front desk (where they were very apologetic and offered to switch our rooms again). They sent the technician again, and when we came back from dinner the front desk told us the issue was finally resolved, which it was. However, when we woke up in the morning, there was a bill under our door even though we had a second night left to stay. It turns out, because it was a 2 night stay with the second night free because of SPG points, when they switched our room, they hadn't linked the two nights together, and the 2nd night was still in the original room. As a result, our room keys stopped working in the elevator and our rooms by noon time. The front desk quickly resolved that issue once we went downstairs again. For our troubles, the front desk did remove the valet charge for one night. Other than the issues encountered - which the front desk was apologetic and attempted to quickly resolve - the hotel is very nice. The gym is of good size. The pool area looked nice, although it could have been a larger pool. All staff were very helpful and cheery, and we received good recommendations from the concierge on 2 occasions. I would stay at this hotel again upon visiting Montreal given its cleanliness, spaciousness and proximity to all, even with the issues we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast Buffett”
Reviews.Author: IslandFolks
Reviews.Content: Right off, I will tell you that we did not stay here, but visited the hotel for its breakfast buffet. My wife has a number of food allergeries and preferences and most restaurants fall short. We must say that the breakfast buffett was the best on our latest trip to Montreal, Nova Scotia, Minnesota and Florida. It was so good my wife went back several times. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “A favourite in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Westin Montreal in September 2010 when in town for a wedding (held in the cityâ€™s Plateau neighbourhood),but this was our third stay at the hotel. The hotel is near public transportation (between Metro Square Victoria and Metro Place dâ€™Armes on the orange line) and is located adjacent to Old Montreal and across from the cityâ€™s convention centre. Though this makes less of a difference in the summer,the drive-in atrium is quite a civilized feature in Montrealâ€™s messy winter months. We have generally found all of the hotel staff to be excellent. Combined with the new facilities and dependable Westin dÃ©cor and features (heavenly bed/shower, etc),this makes this one of our two go-to hotels in the city we visit the most frequently. It seems that we are always offered free wi-fi at check-in, though we have never taken advantage of this (no roaming charges for 3G within Canada). We have stayed in a Deluxe King room (which has two walls of windows, but feels slightly less spacious, perhaps due to the column in the room), a Westin Club King room (with access to the difficult-to-find club lounge), and a Premium King room (probably the most spacious with a small separate, though windowless, sitting room that is separated from the bedroom by a hall and the bathroom). For just a relaxing weekend away, we prefer the bright and airy Deluxe, but for meeting up with friends, the Premiumâ€™s sitting area is also nice. The glass-bottom pool is a fun gimmick, though it is not particularly practical for swimming laps. I assume that children find this endlessly entertaining given that we spent half an hour just floating above the glass portion, looking at the guests entering and leaving through the driveway three stories below. The fitness facilities are very good, as well. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and high-quality.While we are not huge fans of the buffet concept, this one has won us over. There is occasionally a line-up on weekends. We have had tapas in the bar during one of our stays, but the abundance of restaurants in Old Montreal diminishes the appeal of eating at the hotel. Starbucks is at the end of the block (past the Embassy Suites). Having stayed at various hotels in the city (including the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth, the Hyatt Centre-Ville, the Hilton Bonaventure, the Delta Centre-Ville, the Sofitel, the Doubletree, and the Marriott), the Westin has become one of our two favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Would happily return”
Reviews.Author: tripbiscuit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joy from start to finish. Staff rushed to help me up the steps to reception; check-in was quick, pleasant and efficient; and the requests I'd made about room preferences were honoured even though I'd paid a pretty low rate. I had a beautiful room on a high floor with a view of the river and beyond. This hotel was a welcome contrast after a disappointing stay elsewhere; everything in the room functioned well, and it had all the facilities I would have expected from a good four star hotel, including free internet access. I spent an afternoon just enjoying the view and chilling out. Nice touches were free newspapers delivered each day, and free cold drinks in the lobby. The hotel bar was fine: empty when I arrived after the jazz had ended, but it filled up fairly rapidly. There's also a bar right across the street that sells microbrews. The only downside was that the pool was pretty small and seemed to be always full of children playing - so it's not much use if, like me, you like to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nice location”
Reviews.Author: myxz
Reviews.Content: We went there over the 7/1 weekend (national holiday and jazz festival taking place) so Montreal was very crowded. The Check-in at 1am was very slow - and despite the time, there were a bunch of us waiting to check in. The person at the desk acknowledged the wait/frustration and gave us complimentary water bottles which was helpful - since we had a long drive of 7+ hrs. Tried room service but they said they were very busy and wait would be over 40 min so we gave up and went to bed. Positives: great bed and nice room, Nice Gym. Free Wi-fi! Location is great right near Old Montreal and walking distance to downtown. Refrigerator in the room - helpful to keep some drinks in the room. Negatives: dirty/used coffee filter in the coffeemaker filter area covered with condensation - we called the desk and they came to clean the filter but we were repulsed by it and never bothered using it the entire time we stayed. Who knows how long it was in there for? If it weren't for this, I would rate the hotel experience as excellent. Pool was smaller than expected - high children traffic. The jacuzzi- area wasn't much of one - just a warm tub - no water jets. Slow and inefficient valet parking system (they don't take down the model or the car license plate so when you want to pick up the car, the guy ends up looking for it for 15 min and coming back to ask for the car model and color afterall). tip: There are less expensive indoor parking nearby - so you don't HAVE to keep the car at the hotel valet parking (approx $26/night). We didn't take the car out till we were ready to leave Montreal - very easy to get around on foot and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really 4 Star Overall”
Reviews.Author: AdaminToronto
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel as far as Westins go. There are two towers, with no elevator from the lobby, at least for the tower I stayed in. You have to take an escalator and then an elevator to get to your room. Having booked a "suite" with a king size bed and a "separate" room with a pull out sofabed, I was disappointed to find that the separate room was really just a foyer space with no door. There was a 2nd tv in the "room", which was otherwise bleak. The sofabed when opened permitted a space of about 4 inches between the metal frame and the wooden chesterfield housing a fridge, drawers and the tv. This means you have to sidestep in to the main room, and, like me, you could cut your leg. Next, the "swimming" pool. It is a wading pool. You cannot swim in it, even if it was not filled with kids, which it was when I visited on a weekend. There is a small hottub, also probably filled with children's urine, and a sauna I did not try. Other notable incidents, which were actually humorous to me and my friend, were the fact that dirty dishes and cutlery sat in a hallway windowsill for the duration of our 3 day stay (the bet was offered at day 2 that it would not be cleaned before we left). Also, having left a $5 tip for the maid after the first night, she was apparently not happy, as she left my boxer shorts strewn on the bed (which was made), and the comforter thrown over a chair, not even folded. It made me yearn for cheap hotels in Cuba where the maids go out of their way to turn the towels into swans and such. Other than that, the location is great. The room service menu is smaller than other hotels, but the prices seemed reasonable. All I ordered was a pitcher of fresh orange juice. When they delivered orange juice from concentrate, the $20 charge was refunded. The room was otherwise fine, and clean, except for a dirty night table that was cleaned when I called for service. Oh, and put the do not disturb sign on your door or the maid will knock around 8 am, because apparently most people on vacation get up at that hour on the weekend and are out and about such that the room is ready to be cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JaxNJ
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel and the friendliest, most helpful staff. From the valet to the front desk to the dining room to our guest room - everything was beautifully decorated and very clean. The restaurant had *wonderful* food. The location was terrific. I can't say one thing about this hotel that would give them an opportunity for improvement - they are doing absolutely everything right. HIGHLY recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Great Location, Great Food and Jazz”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTravelnut
Reviews.Content: We came for the Jazz Fest with another couple. The Westin is the perfect location. Close to Old Montreal, Chinatown, museums, location of the jazz fest, and downtown were all within walking distance. Unfortunately, it rained while we were there, so that put a damper on the outside activities. We got great advice from the staff for restaurants. Room was spacious and very comfortable. We'll stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Anniverary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jsgopher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location - within walking distance to Old Montreal and Jazz fest activities. Very clean room and very comfortable beds. Our room was very quiet and very dark which made for great sleeping. No view, but that didn't matter to me. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was good, but overpriced. They gave us a coupon and we only paid for one which made it a decent value. Pool situated for lap swimmers and might not be ideal for kids. Nice workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: 032312g
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, five days: phone did not work, TV remote did not work, one bath robe for two people, shampoo and conditioner were replaced once, lotion was not replaced ever, coffee station was not stock up upon arrival, I asked to refill it on my way out, came back to the room at 11:00 pm: it was not done, had to go downstairs (phone still doesn't work!) and ask one more time. Next morining after arrival sent the maid away as I was still in bed, guess what: she never came back, no towels, no garbage removal for two days. The bill arrived on time, as they want to be paid. If I were the manager, instead of posting his comments how happy/unhappy he is reading all the reviews, I would be doing random walk through and implementing a better check out list to follow. But I am not the manager and the company paid this bill, with me already voicing about their poor choice of the venue. One more thing: vases in the hall had cloudy water with dying flowers. It does show the level of care.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Heaven bed”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1177
Reviews.Content: I didnt plan the accommodation for this trip but was pleasantly surprised to be booked at the Westin. Great location - accross from the Palais de Congress. Walk out the front of the hotel for shopping. Go out the back for old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “On business during the Grand Prix weekend - Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: MStow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect for its grade. Clean, well staffed, spacious, good food and small touches that make a difference. An ideal location to be put up in Montreal for a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Close to Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LovingSunandSand
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, clean, and the room was great. I liked the nice and large bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. Although we didn't try the restaurant, we did order room service one evening and it was a good meal that came with a little vase of flowers, a great touch. We decided to pick a hotel that was close to the VIA rail station (about a 5-10 min. walk) and Old Montreal. We walked to Chinatown, Cathedral, Old Montreal, waterfront, shopping downtown, and Mont Royal Park. If you don't mind walking, you can get to many places.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncg1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends in early June. The hotel is well located (near Old Montreal & the CBD) and is very clean and fairly upscale. Overall, a good value and great choice with many restaurants and points of interests within a few minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel spoiled by terrible service - in every department!”
Reviews.Author: JDE260767
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here for 3 days. Hotel looks new, well equipped, spacious and bright. However, housekeeping was very poor and when I complained, issues were still not resolved by the end of the stay. Dirty rooms with previous guests food and dirty glasses lying around is NOT good! Restaurant food was good, but again terrible service. Orders were extremely slow, arrived late and incorrect - several times during the stay. Restaurant has inadequate number of tables, so you have to eat breakfast at the bar. I travel to Montreal reguarly on business and have stayed at several hotels. This one looks good, but scratch beneath the surface and it's very unimpressive. I will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, upscale hotel, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Montreal was only for a few days, and at first it was difficult deciding where to stay. The location of le Westin was perfect for quick access to Old Montreal, as well as the shopping districts of St. Catherine's. It's also close to the water front, Science Centre, etc. The hotel itself is fantastic. Our kids loved the pool with the glass inserts on the bottom so that you could see (and wave to) the people arriving below on the first floor. It was also our daughter's 10th birthday the day we checked in and within 10 minutes of checking into our room, the concierge delivered complimentary cookies, milk and a birthday card! The service at all times was excellent. There are very good restaurants near by, and the subway stop is just a couple of minutes away (walking). We'll definitely stay there on our next visit. Room 2121 has an incredible view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Grandpa_Walton
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location if you want to be near the "Old Port". We had a room on the 12th floor/corner deluxe room.... The views were great and the room was clean and nice but nothing spectacular. When booking the room we chose the deluxe room with the SPA Shower etc. The SPa Shower is a regular shower with one head that has 2 basic settings. I find this to be a bit miss lending on the part of Westin. The Beds are comfortable but the pillows are very firm. The pool is nice but small and they have a sauna(dry), hot tub and cold water plunge pool. This makes for a relaxing time. The Location is great if you want to visit the "Old Port" and Gibby's is only 6 minute walk. Over all we had a very good stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service With Our Reservation”
Reviews.Author: Mrlbroman
Reviews.Content: We encountered some difficulty with our travel and had to make adjustments to our reservations. The third party agent we had used to book the hotel, Hotels.com, left us hanging out to dry. The reservations manager at Le Westin did not. THANK YOU. When it was finally all said and done, the Hotels.com customer service agent told me she had "convinced the reservations manager" to make the requested changes. Not true. It was the reservations manager at Le Westin with whom I spoke personally who provided the excellent customer service. Our family will return to Le Westin. I will not be using Hotels.com (owned by Expedia) in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVermont_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my teenage daughters and one friend in order to check out McGill. I can not say enough great things about this hotel! Hotel was immaculate, room had a great view, and bathroom was generously sized with an awesome shower. The teenagers even loved the pool area! The concierge (I wish I knew her name) was outstanding and switched from French to English back to French flawlessly. Even the valets were terrific. I will absolutely stay here whenever I am in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dundastraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great Westin. It is an old newspaper building that has been beautifully turned into a great hotel. At first, seeing a shower only (no tub) I was suprised, and a total lack of views from the rooms was surprising as well, but those were the only negatives I came across. Otherwise the rooms and facilities were outstanding. The staff were extremely friendly and geuinely seemed to take ownership of their jobs....a sign of really good management. It is hard to beleive that this is the same hotel chain as the dump they call a in Westin in Ottawa. This is 10 times the hotel and so well run that you feel that you are a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve at Le Westin Montreal! Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: researchnerd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Westin Montreal for a few nights in late December, including New Years Eve. Our group booked a couple rooms using a corporate rate and I feel that we made the right decision choosing a Westin property. The location of the hotel was perfect, Old Montreal had tons of historic sights and restaurants to choose from, and was a short cab ride to the bars, clubs, and casino that we visited at night. The hotel only has valet parking, which for $25 was not a bad deal considering if you called down ahead of time they could have your car ready in 10 minutes flat (there was also an underground city lot across the street which was $20 a night, but for the extra $5 why not go with the hotels). The service was great, the front desk was very pleasant, even when dealing with a pretty large group. We were treated with a Globe and Mail newspaper every morning and housekeeping would always come back at a later time since we often slept in. The rooms were nice and modern, about average for a 4-star hotel. The 2 queen beds were large and comfortable, the room included a minibar to store your drinks as well as an ipod player/alarm clock, and the bathrooms had a very nice glass enclosed shower with a rainfall showerhead. Some members of our group opted to go for suites and I would highly recommend getting one, the bedrooms were much larger and having 2 bathrooms and a sitting area was great for entertaining. The fitness gym/sauna area was pretty amazing, with treadmills, free weights and weight machines rivaling those of most private clubs. Unfortunately the indoor pool was under construction/maintenance so we werenâ€™t able to use it, but the front-desk informed us of this at check-in and offered us keycards to access the pool at the neighbouring Intercontinental. The only fault I found at the hotel was the price of room service, it was pretty outrageous. But with tons of dining options nearby we found some pretty good places to eat out. All in all I had a couple great nights at the hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone else staying in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Westin I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal about once a month from Toronto and usually stay at the Sheraton. I tried the Westin for some variety and here's the verdict: Pro: Nice rooms Near Old Montreal Nice gym, but the pool is very small Free wireless internet- same at Sheraton Cons: The area is a bit far from the business area Hard to get taxi's. I had to wait 10 min each morning. There was snow but at the Sheraton you never wait. Room service menu was strange- only one beef dish and 4 fish for dinner. Not an issue for me but some people might like more meat dishes. I also thought the restaurant for breakfast wasn't great. The buffet is adequate but I've seen much better (Westin Calgary). I would probably stay here again if it was for vacation but I think the Sheraton is better suited for business.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: check in was quick and professional. i appreciated the spacious rooms and the nice pool, although the Interconti pool is beter. Breakfast buffet was wonderful, again very good service. From a location point of view it is not ideal but you can reach most places easily. Maje sure to get a room with a view, some rooms only give wall view....

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed and so much more.”
Reviews.Author: akcrrr
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Westin for 2 nights over the New Year's holiday and I can not say enough about our stay. The location is great (near the Cathedral, Old Port, St. Catherine's, and the Metro/Underground City) and the service was excellent. Vallet and check-in were swift and it was definitely nice to be able to get out of your car and be inside. We had a plan where breakfast buffet was included and I was pleasantly surprised by the great choices and that the staff was so friendly and attentive. Coffee and juice were never empty. The beds live up to their name and the room was large enough to fit a full-sized sofa and a few chairs which was great if you wanted to watch TV or eat and not be laying down in bed. We experienced a problem with a movie we ordered and called the front desk to have it taken care of and they removed the charge and sent someone to fix it right away which was great. Only negatives I could say would be that the pool is closed until further notice and that there is not much in terms of a traditional hotel bar available. They have one tucked away in the restaurant, but it would have been nice to get a drink one night at a lobby bar. Overall it was a great stay and I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The problem with raised expectations...”
Reviews.Author: piselli
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Westin following an excellent experience earlier in the week. A problem with setting a high standard is that expectations are raised; on this second visit, things did not go as smoothly but it was still, overall, a good experience. The first room we were given had a large red wine stain on the carpet and bed skirt. It was also smaller and darker than our previous room, so we asked to be moved. The very helpful desk clerk offered us a corner room on a lower floor; we lost the view but gained light and space. This room was massive, but with wasted space due to an odd layout. Instead of a glass-enclosed shower, there was a bath-shower combination; the bath was too shallow to be useful for anything but bathing children, but the shower was fine. There was a shortage of hooks and the towel stack included a frayed and stained hand towel that looked like a rag. Hard to see how this could have been missed. The bed, as before, was so wonderful that it was hard to leave the room. And the front desk service was excellent; warm and accommodating. Early check-in and late checkout were not a problem. Internet was free and fast. Three additional service critiques: we booked a rate that was to include some gifts and amenities; on both visits we had to request them when it was clear they were not forthcoming. At check-out, the very sweet porter was prepared to send us off with someone elseâ€™s bag until we noticed the mistake. And the buffet breakfast continued to be a disappointment with dried out and unappealing food on offer. Despite the glitches, we felt that the hotel offered good value for money, with spacious, bright rooms and good views (on the higher floors), accommodating staff, and very comfortable beds. For the rate we secured, we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: 2due
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Westin and then moved on to the Nelligan. That was a mistake-- the Nelligan did not compare favourably in professionalism of staff, room comfort, or overall value. We stayed in a corner room (traditional) on the 20th floor; it was extremely spacious and bright, with a view of the port. The bed, as promised, was exceptionally comfortable. The staff were fantastic right from the moment of arrival-- warm and professional, sending additional requested supplies immediately and helping with a restaurant reservation. The housekeeper also went beyond the call of duty. The pool is still out of service, but they are providing passes for the Intercontinental Hotel pool next door (hours were limited so we weren't able to avail of it). The only weak point of the experience was the buffet breakfast in the Gazette restaurant: omelettes, sausages and pancakes were dried out and inedible; oatmeal watery. Grim. We had planned to try another hotel in Montreal, but will return to the Westin later this week based on a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, but the restaurant service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: The only reason I did not give an overall 5* is because the restaurant service was truly awful. The food was FANTASTIC but the service let this wonderful hotel down and needs to be sorted out. I am a Platinum Starwood member so I was upgraded to the top floor and the room was lovely, huge cloud-like bed, pristine bathroom (no bath, but large walk-in shower), efficient internet access, doors don't slam (thank you), everything was great. There is no self-parking, it is by valet only, but they are very quick in bringing your car to you when you request it, and the valet guys were very nice and friendly. The Concierge lounge serves appetizers at 5pm and I had some lovely Quebec cheese and fruit, and then I had some delightful pastries. If I hadn't already made dinner arrangements I would have definitely eaten in the restaurant, but the breakfast experience in the restaurant the next morning was a sorry state of affairs. They ask you to wait to be seated and then nobody shows up to seat you. I stood waiting and the restaurant manager knew I was there but was busy talking to a customer and just ignored me - and he did not alert any of his staff to come and seat me. In the end I got mad and collared a server who was very pleasant and professional and seated me rightaway, but then the server assigned to my table ignored me as well. The breakfast buffet is to die for, the food was exceptionally superb, so the service people should be ashamed of themselves. WESTIN - please put this right, your hotel is fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean Rooms at Affordable Prices”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelerBD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and beautiful, and the rooms were quite comfortable and spacious. Very affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience on my first time in montreal”
Reviews.Author: mrepetto
Reviews.Content: Great experience, it was my first time in Montreal, after long hours of travelling from Argentina, I went directly to that hotel, was refreshing!. Rooms were perfect size, not big, not small just perfect, good business desk, complimentary internet, great speed, ideal for business. Location is perfect, a few blocks from old montreal, and within walking distance to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Le Westin is heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingFoodie_10
Reviews.Content: Le Westin Montreal is ideally located on rue Saint Antoine in the Old Port, but with easy access to the Metro directly across the street at the Place d'Armes station in the Palais des CongrÃ¨s. The location allows for both walking and Metro access to the Old Port area as well as the Chinatown and Gay Village districts and the famous rue Sainte-Catherine. Walking to the Plateau Mont-Royal district is a little more difficult if you're not a great walker, but any area is easily accessible with the Metro! The staff at Le Westin are both friendly and welcoming, and very accommodating with most requests. The concierge was extremely helpful in assisting with directions as well as making dinner reservations for us. The true bliss of Le Westin, however, are the Heavenly Bed and the Heavenly Shower. The bed is so luxuriously clean and comfortable that you may not want to leave it (but you can purchase it, complete with the amazing bedding, at the Westin's online store!), and the dual-headed shower lends itself to long, hot decadence after a day of walking and sightseeing in Montreal. Pricing was very reasonable, especially when included with a flight in an online package. This was the second time staying at this location, and because of the atmosphere, cleanliness, comfort, wonderful staff and ideal location, it is where I will always choose to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Odd problems, but nothing major. Convenient location and comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: kala327
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin due to a favorable deal I found on the Tourisme Montreal site in which the 2nd night was half the price of the first. I was also pricing out the Embassy Suites right next door but the only deal comparable involved a full, non-refundable prepayment which I am always a little skittish about just in case of an unforeseen change of plans. The "Fall Sweet Deal" via the Tourisme Montreal site also included the breakfast buffet, some soap products from a Canadian company and various coupons (which I didn't use). The purpose of my stay was for a weekend getaway to Montreal and Quebec City. The hotel was next to the convention center, but my motive for staying here was more the proximity to the "Old Town/Old Port" as well as a relatively central metro station and the city center itself. I didn't look to stay in the Old Port proper as I wanted to be close to a metro and I prefer larger hotels to boutique hotels. My late (close to midnight) arrival was flawless as check-in was a breeze. I've never stayed in a Westin but have read many reviews praising their "heavenly beds" so after a long flight and late arrival I was hoping the reviews were accurate. Sure enough they were. I don't usually sleep particularly restful in a hotel, but the bed was fantastic, and made me feel like I made the right move sticking with the Westin instead of the slightly cheaper Embassy Suites next door. The breakfast buffet was a nice spread, although not cooked-to-order. They did have bagels, smoked salmon, meats, and pre-made omelettes, cereals, fresh fruits, pancakes, etc. The wait service consistently underperformed on both mornings as they never topped up my tea nor took away the used plates, but overall it is a minor point in an otherwise above-average breakfast buffet. As noted by another reviewer, the pool was indeed out of service, but I came to sight-see, not to swim so it didn't matter to me. I imagine that some people particularly choose a hotel on the basis whether it has an indoor pool or not, so if this is important to you, I would call ahead as the bulletin from the hotel implied that the pool would be closed until further notice. The room was modern and I loved that the shower had a glass door instead of a shower curtain, except I was surprised to find that the shower faucet was broken. It literally was detached from the fixture. I could get the shower to work by holding the fixture while I turned it, but nothing was holding it up and keeping it from crashing to the floor. I called the operator who didn't seem to know how to respond to this odd problem. She didn't offer to change the room but said they could send someone up to look at it. I declined as I was on a short timetable and didn't want to be hassled with workers coming in and out of the room, but I was surprised the shower faucet was completely broken as you would think the cleaning staff would have noticed this when they last cleaned the shower. I asked that they note my account to ensure no one thought I broke it and she said she would and I never heard anything again from the hotel management about this. No apology, no offer to change rooms, nothing. It was a strange inconvenience and I suppose I could have insisted to change rooms, just at that point it wasn't worth the hassle. I reminded them again when I checked out (that the faucet was broken) -- so that they didn't place another unsuspecting tourist in that room until they fixed it -- and the front desk clerk acted as if this was the first he heard of this, so my guess is the operator on day one never noted my account. Either way, I wasn't looking for a down charge but I think they could have at least acknowledged and apologized for the hassle as a courteous gesture. Otherwise, as other reviewers have noted, there really isn't much storage space on the vanity. If you bring a lot of stuff with you when you travel, this is something to keep in mind. In fact, the housekeeper had no choice but to put extra towels on top of the toilet tank. For as clean as they may keep the toilet, I find this off-putting and something I might expect to see on a lower class hotel, if at all. The drawer pulls on the dressers are very awkward, narrow and hard to grab as they are akin to small, little solid tassels. in fact, when I went to open one drawer, the pull actually came off the drawer. I don't think I've ever noted a drawer pull in a review, but after the shower faucet remained in my hand after I tried to turn it on (because it wasn't attached to the wall), I guess I should have been surprised when the drawer pull remained in my hand as well. It wasn't attached anymore to the drawer, perhaps the screw was too bored out. Obviously, they cut some corners during installation. I hear the hotel is relatively new so it just seemed odd to have these problems. The internet access was included and worked just fine on my iphone for the duration of my stay. A national newspaper was outside my door on both the weekday and weekend. That was nice as I didn't expect the weekend paper (Saturday). The room wasn't overly large, but it was fine for a short stay. On my second and last morning, I noticed that the statement printout that they slid under the door had my stay rated my incorrectly and, as a result, they charged me an extra $20. Fortunately, I had my printout from my reservation and they credited me for the difference without any problem, although it took two trips to the front desk to get this done. Had I not had my printout I imagine it would have been a different story. All in all, it was not a hassle-free stay, but the bed was great and the location was convenient so I was pleased overall. I don't plan on going back to Montreal but if it were in my plans I would likely look elsewhere only because there are many other hotels to choose from in the same/similar class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but could improve the business centre”
Reviews.Author: Stylus
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a quiet part of Montreal and the rooms are spacious and exquisite. If traveling for business I would highly recommend bringing your laptop and allowing plenty of time for any additional business centre requirements. The "business centre" is located within a hallway which can be noisy at times, and during my stay the internet and printers were not working. However the front desk were accommodating and went out of their way to help. The business centre is but one flaw in an otherwise very well designed and run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A Sheraton with Clean Sheets.....”
Reviews.Author: BigAdverturer
Reviews.Content: I love the folks at this hotel; they are very pleasant and helpful. But...the hotel property and the rooms remind me of a Sheraton with the added benefit of clean sheets. I was not impressed. Pay the extra and go to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Priced for the Comfort, Convenience & Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Coco71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend with our 2 & 10 year old daughters. It was about twice as much as the bed and breakfasts we initially looked at, but offered more services and had many available rooms. Great location just a couple of blocks from Notre Dame Basillica (hint: exit the back door of the hotel to Rue St. Jacques), novel swimming pools, elegant lounge, valet parking, easy check-in / check-out, all standard for the Westin. .

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Sleep - yes, but otherwise nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Bywalec
Reviews.Content: The highs: Heavenly bed. Cool pool. Very thoughtful enclosed drive up. The lows: No pool infrastructure. Poor room /bath design. No bathtubs in 85% of rooms. Bland decor. Can't justify a four star rating. We chose this hotel because it was reportedly renovated and was directly across the street form the Palais des CongrÃ¨s. We checked at about 02:00, after a late flight and really appreciated the incredibly comfortable beds and crispy fresh sheets. We were surprised in the morning though, to find that there was no bathtub in the room. in the shower, we quickly ran out of shampoo and soap, as it seemed the room was set up for single occupancy and on an "amenity budget". The room was otherwise adequate in size and felt spacious. The desk was small though, and the closet cramped. We requested a room with a tub, and the front desk supervisor accommodated us with a nice room on the 10th floor. Unfortunately the closet was now truly microscopic at only 19" of hanger space - barely enough for one person. There was no stationery in the room, and no minibar (read: small fridge). There were 3 wall outlets in the room, two all in use for the various fixtures and the one not in use was in an awkward place behind a sofa. The desk mounted "power panel" did not work, so guess where I had to plug in the laptop and the cell? Again, symbolic amounts of towels, soap and shampoo prompted a call to the "action line". Some 30 minutes later the goods arrived, but the housekeeper cleverly dropped the towels and supplies on the bed, and ran for dear life. We soon discovered why, when we tried to put the loot in the bathroom: NO place at all to put any of it down, unless inside the handbasin. Not an inch of usable horizontal surface, and the access to what was available was hampered by the door which would not open fully and by the clever placement of the cabinet (see photo) right against the wall to make things worse. Very poor design it seems. The AV and the HVAC were all in working order and met all our expectation. The internet was included in the rate and worked well. The room decor was neutral, with "model home" look and feel, a bit sterile / generic. The carpet was in good condition and clean, but not comfortable and certainly did not feel "heavenly" . The pool infrastructure was non existent though: you will have to change in the single solitary postage stamp sized toilet with a pedestal sink and a shower stall, as no change rooms are provided. Inside there was no shelf to put clothes on while changing. There are no lockers in the pool area to store your clothes while using the pool. In short one has to walk wet to your room after the swim. The swimming pool itself was interesting, though: located right over the enclosed drive up (excellent for those cold windy wintry days in Montreal) with a see through glass bottom revealing a perfect view of the motor lobby, equally treating arriving guests to a vista of swimmers in the pool from the bottom: a peeping Tom's / exhibitionists dream - all others please keep your bathing suits on and no hanky panky!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.....great rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: grammysharon
Reviews.Content: Le Westin made our visit to Montreal wonderful. Breakfast was great, the pool and the gym were great. The coincerage didn't was give us the best directions. The rest of the staff were more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD but not really up to the westin i ve been before”
Reviews.Author: pmetka
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok overall , but not amazing . looks like the hotel is more dedicated to business customers than for leisure it makes the room and the rest of the hotel looking very cold and impersonal . But strangely we booked a room on the executive floor , hoping to get all the executive amenities , checkin, BB , aperitif and drinks , but nop , we had to have the BB at the main restaurant and no aperitif was served in the lounge , just help yourself free soft drinks were available . location was good .

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to all Montreal has to offer”
Reviews.Author: beaudguinn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel within walking distance to the Old Montreal and Port area, as well as Chinatown and downtown shopping. Our room was on tht top floor overlooking the Port and we were able to see where to go from our room. We walked to the port for our dinner cruise and then back to the hotel afterwards stopping to admire the area. Nice restaurant/bar named The Gazette which is Montreal's english newspaper. Wonderful selection of all drinks and food. Would definintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel on edge of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Allmuzklvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a romantic getaway in Montreal. It's a new hotel- very modern and classy. Rooms were very comfortable, clean and modern. Great location if you want to be right at Old Montreal. A good walk to St. Catherine St and shopping, but do-able. The pools were smaller than we thought. Had breakfast at the hotel. Food was very good, but it was very expensive. Fitness centre is amazing (we looked at it :-)) Special thanks to hotel-- we found a nice bottle of wine greeting us in our room as it was our wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Le Westin Montreal”
Reviews.Author: adegroot
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 6 hours of driving from Toronto, exhausted but jubilated. The front foyer is spectacular with skylight that was actually the pool. Our room was luxurious, all new fixtures, bedding etc. The only negatives were the cards didn't work well in the elevators and there was a problem hotel-wide with recieving a tv signal. But everything else was sublime, from the beautiful spa environment, no noise in our room, but it was the perfect temperture. I would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper049
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our two young children whilst my husband was on business. The food at the restaurant on site was excellent along with the room service. Our children loved the glass bottom pool and it was nice to have a staff member who sat right beside the pool and watched all of the children. We had a suite which was very comfortable. My only comment would be there was no bathtub in our suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very clean”
Reviews.Author: MigMedic
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean hotel, good service. The hotel is only a year old and we had a great stay. My only complaint was the buffet breakfast. It was $21 each and was substandard. All the food was cold and the eggs, advertised as cook to order was cold and jellied scrambled eggs. Perfume was sprayed throughout lobby, not a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “A New Gem”
Reviews.Author: Njella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Westin for a few days in July - what a great experience - the place is new (and big), the beds were comfy, the bathrooms were new and modern. We had to change hotels after a few nights. The girls didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: bjouve
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in superior room. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, as always in Quebec. The hotel is very well located: right across the street of the congress center and on the border of the international and historical areas. The room was very large, confortable, but a little sad. Don't pay extra $ for access to the executive club: food is very limited and except for a small choice of soft drink, you have to pay for anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, service needs some work”
Reviews.Author: bizwarrior
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin because of its pool and location near the Old City. It was certainly fine for both those needs. It is a busy convention spot so not a lot of personal care or attention. The staff was harried. The restaurant wasn't too good. Service was poor and room service tripped up. The high speed required lots of TLC to get up and running every day. That was a hassle. Glass bottom pool and swimming area are super fun as is the back door entrance to the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for the Montreal tourist”
Reviews.Author: TomChatt
Reviews.Content: We found the Westin a clean, business-class hotel in an excellent location, and with helpful staff. Our room, on an upper floor in the Tour St Jacques, was spacious, and had a nice view over the old town. The room was what I would consider a solid business-class 4-star quality: spacious, a good bed, a good desk, wifi, typical closet, nicely appointed bathroom with glass-enclosure shower, well-stocked. The concierge was quite efficient and helpful in setting up restaurant reservations and providing general advice. (For restaurants, they would give you a printout with your rsvp info, including directions and description of the resto -- a handy touch.) There were always bellboys in the lobby to help if needed. The pool was over the port-cochere and had a glass bottom, which was quite unique and fun to look at, which we took a few moments to do whenever we went in or out the front door. The location is very central -- just steps to the Place d'Armes (old town), across the street from the convention center and a Metro stop. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service - what a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: no_hills
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin without much research as we could book on points. Having had such poor service at another Westin property, our expectations were low. The hotel is new, with modern design that is not cutting edge but appeals to a wide variety of people. From the moment we pulled up, staff were available, friendly, and seemed geniunely concerned that our needs were being met. Requests for cribs and connecting rooms were handled quickly and efficiently. The rooms themselves were huge. The pool area was fantastic - not only is there a pool and hot tub, but also a cold plunge pool. The bottom of the pool is glass, and overlooks the hotel entrance. You can look up from the entrance and see people swimming. Surprising touches like goggles and swimming toys were appreciated. Rooms were clean and well appointed, although we were not informed the room was an accessible room and had no bathtub, and little counter space. My only criticism was that lunch in the not very busy restaurant took longer than expected, although service was again very good, and the food quality was excellent. A good choice even if not travelling on points.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location and price paid.”
Reviews.Author: Tim-Purdy
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 2 nights, booked the hotel via price line with you name it pricing and paid less than half for each night we stayed. Room was clean, plush and brand new. Other than valet which was typical for big city 26/day CAN, we did not use any other services. But very close to notre dame, rue st. Paul and the metro to get around so we did not use car the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: MelZim
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient, but the things to note are: - The beds are very soft. - The continental breakfast may not be included in your price. If it is not, I wouldn't recommend eating there. - You do not have to pay to check in for your flight if using the business centre computer

Reviews.Title: “Fab brand new hotel with fantastic service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AbfabNorfolk
Reviews.Content: You wont go wrong with this hotel. It is only 18 months old and everything is new. The bathrooms and showers are plush and the beds comfy. The bar is great fun and the concierge was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin with Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: VABoston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous labor day weekend in Montreal. Everything except the hotel experience was great about the vacation. As a frequent guest at Westin's, I can surely say, the Westin Montreal had the worst service of any. The hotel is relatively new and the rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well done. The location is also very convenient and great for exploring old Montreal. But the service leaves a lot to be desired. For the whole duration of our stay, we could not access wireless internet even after numerous service calls. When called to find out the location of the ice machine, the service express attendant directed us to the wrong floor and suggested that they don't know the exact location of the machine and we will have to walk the floor to find it. One day the housekeeping did not arrive till 5PM, just when we had returned to the room to get some rest. When we requested the hotel to push the cleaning back an hour, they suggested that they will not be able to guarantee housekeeping services in that case. The pool is quite small and primarily meant for children. I hope Le Westin Montreal improves its service quality and become a great choice for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: IntTravelMonger
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend. It is centrally located and an easy walk to Old Montreal and downtown. The subway is right across the street. The hotel itself is true Westin style -- super modern and super clean. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “It's standard fare - but sometimes that's exactly what you want”
Reviews.Author: pariszmyspot
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 2 family members including a teenager on her first international trip. I chose the Westin based on its location and our longstanding experience staying at the chain in the States. We were pleased with the choice. The hotel is excellently located. We walked to everything except the botanical gardens/olympic stadium. For those who prefer to ride, the metro is approximately one block away. We seldom dined in the hotel - only breakfast and dessert - because of numerous dining options in the surrounding areas. However, the food was good with a well-stocked buffet option and the service attentive. The room was clean and large enough to accomodate 2 adults and a teen without our stepping on and over one another. Housekeeping staff responded quickly to requests. While there is nothing spectacular about the hotel, it fit our family's needs on this trip to a tee and sometimes that's enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Othello491
Reviews.Content: Positives: -Very comfortable beds and great bathrooms -Great location close to Old Montreal and around the corner from a metro station -Helpful and polite staff allowed us to check in early; good concierge service. -Free wi-fi; no problems with connecting. Negatives: -Housekeeping staff simply did not show up. I had to call the front desk to get my room cleaned. -The front desk mistakenly charged me for food from the hotel restaurant, and it took a very long time for them to resolve the issue. -Long waits for the lifts as two of three were under repairs. -Expensive parking. Overall: The hotel promotes itself as one of the top places to stay in Montreal. They come close, but the overall execution failed to live up to the way it presents itself. If I am paying a premium rate for a hotel, I have (perhaps an unreasonable) expectation for the service to be nearly flawless. While I thought that the facilities were top notch, the level of service needs work. It's unacceptable that there were problems with things as basic as housekeeping. I would certainly consider staying at the Westin again (if only for their beds), but I am not willing to pay a premium for a hotel that can't even clean my room in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alessio-Roma-Italy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Westin in mid August 2010. The hotel is in the center of the city, about 5 minutes walk to Old Montreal, but is very quiet. Modern and brand new building, very clean and elegant. As a Starwood Preferred guest, they gave us a Westin Club King room on 21st floor that was fantastic, with complimentary evening hors d'oeuvres and full buffet american breakfast. The room was small with a big king bed with their heavenly bed and lines (incredible!!!!) and a big bath with shower, robes and any kind of amenities. Breakfast is served in a nice setting and is very good, with a plenty of eggs, smoked salmon, pancakes, waffles, muffins, etc... The only thing is that there's a line and you have to wait to get a table. Maybe they should organize breakfast in a bigger place. The personnel is very qualified, professional and friendly. We really enjoyed staying here but we do believe it is a bit expensive, especially the valet parking wich is 25 CAD per day. If you go there and you want to get to Old Montreal, remember to exit/enter from the back entrance of the hotel wich is a big shortcut!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... where were some of these other pople staying?”
Reviews.Author: mtl59
Reviews.Content: This is first class hotel, whether it has been refurbished or is new! It is very clean perfect condition great staff and large rooms. The internet worked fine for me even on my aged laptop. The location is excellent close to the old city. In short I have stayed in lot of hotels across North America and Europe and this matches the best in its price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Foodie117
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at a Westin and we loved it. The decor is modern and the rooms large and comfortable. The only complaint is that the room lighting could be better.
