Originally, we were given a room on the far side of the hotel which looked out onto nothing but a large blank wall. Yuck! Why have a window at all if that's all we can see. We asked if we could be switched to another room. The manager upgraded us to a room at the front of the hotel with city view. Ahhh! What a tremendous difference it made. It added a lot of natural light to the room that it made our 3 day stay so much more pleasant. The package rate included a breakfast buffet which was quite decent for a free meal. They had Montreal bagels which we loved. The pool was small but my children loved it for the glass bottom view of the hotel driveway. They also enjoyed the hot and cold tubs. Perfect way to wind down after a day of sightseeing. Finally, the best part of the hotel is its location...convenient to Old Montreal and to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not as new as you might think”
Reviews.Author: wombat_syd
Reviews.Content: I went there on a business trip and brought my partner along. The hotel is very nice and seems to have been recently refurbished. Internet, pool, gym, all is there. However, some things are not as perfect as they seem: e.g., the internet connection drops at times, the batteries in the remote control did not work. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and we were able to park our bycicles in the storage room every night. I liked the stay, but expected a little bit more luxury, as the website seems to promise a more impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed- well served”
Reviews.Author: rporter418
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin for five days with spouse and two children under 10. Arrived four hours before listed check in time and found room was ready on arrival. Staff encountered were courteous. Room was very clean and quiet. Hotel security was excellent. Needed your room key to access elevators. Breakfast was well appointed with both light and hearty fare although slightly expensive given two were children. Access to the Metro was across the street from the main doors and there is a rear door on the third floor leading into Vieux Montreal which was great since we planned on spending a great deal of time there. The beds were outstanding, the best in any hotel I've stayed in. Great place for kids to stay, the glass bottom pool, hot tub and cool pool kept them entertained between outings. Other posters have stated the pool had odd hours but it was open 7a to 9p every day.

Reviews.Title: “It's a new hotel,the building used to...”
Reviews.Author: denisdyshko
Reviews.Content: It's a new hotel,the building used to belong to a local newspaper,bit then starwood bought it out and converted into a nice,roomy,clean hotel with an extremely friendly stuff and excellent service.Since it's located in the center of Old city everything is within a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Hunky
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Hotwire for a great price. Staff was friendly for the most part. A couple were "polite" but not friendly if that makes sense (usually some of the men working the front desk). Good location in Old Montreal. Walking distance to different parts of Montreal. The room was very comfortable. The bed is Westin's "Heavenly Bed" and I always let out a nice sigh when I crawled into bed lol. I read where there were two lamps in a room? I had four plus a ceiling light lol. The movie selection isn't new or very "hollywood". The walk-in shower with dual showerhead was great with good pressure. Housekeeping was thorough and I asked for some extra soap and they were very generous. Very quiet hotel too. Never heard any other guests. The only issue was the food. I ordered it a couple times and it was at best ok. Careful of the creme brulee trio... it was undercooked and basically poured off my spoon. The lobster bisque was delish. The club sandwich was good except it deserved a nice flavoured mayo or aioli instead of a little bottle of Hellman's that came with it. I would highly recommend Le Westin and look forward to staying there again if I get the chance. Comfortable, quiet, and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own lightbulbs”
Reviews.Author: amart
Reviews.Content: Currently staying in the hotel. Great walking distance to underground mall,old town,Notre dame, china town. Large quiet hotel. Large room. Even though I am staying for 5nights they put me in a room on the 11th floor with the roof parapet blocking the huge windows. Makes it seem i'm in a hole barely able to see the sky. Weird There are only 2 lamps in the bedroom with no overhead lights. These have fluorescence with such low wattage there is no way you can read at night. They are stingy with toilet tissue for some strange reason and I noticed another reviewer making a comment like that. Room service for lunch was nice and very quick All in all this is a nice hotel. I would probably check out others if I was on my own

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: callstuz
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that there are endless amounts of great choices when choosing a hotel in Montreal. Since I was traveling with a family of five, I was looking for spaciousness and value. I also wanted to be in or near the Old City. Le Westin more than delivered for us. The room (around 500 square feet) fit all of us comfortably. It even had an alcove with a second TV for our oldest to watch. We were literally around the corner from Notre Dame. And the cost was at, or in most cases, below other 4 and 5 star hotels. The gym was quite generous. They have 3 pools: regular, plunge pool, and whirlpool. Not large, but more than adequate for a quick dip. We ate breakfast at the hotel which was very good, but priced like you'd normally expect from a hotel around $16-22. There are several small bakeries in the area if you'd like something more inexpensive and a little more quaint. FYI, in and out parking cost $24 and is on the premises. The concierge at the Le Westin was top-notch. From navigating me on the phone to the hotel, to making dinner reservations at hot restaurants, to booking tours, they came through with flying colors. One added bonus: the Bixi bike rental rack is right next to the hotel...be sure to take advantage and bike this fabulous city! One last thing. If you are a Starwood Preferred Guest, ask about the specials. It's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a hotel for a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: minijubilee
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a young child isn't always easy, but the Westin Montreal made our visit seamless. Early check-in so we could settle in and clean up as soon as we arrived. The room was spacious, with lots of extra chairs, sofas and tables for eating and relaxing in. The hotel pool, while tiny, was perfect for a family swim after a day out exploring the city. Service was excellent in providing the extra bedding we needed for our child. And the quality of food served both in-room and at the hotel restaurant were excellent. The hotel staff were never too busy to help, whether it was with directions or simply holding the elevator door for myself and baby+stroller. Highly recommended for all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie71
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 day weekend in Montreal. I really enjoyed this hotel. It is a brand new hotel and the location, rooms, service, and food were all excellent. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Old Town and also near a Metro station. The Montreal Metro is awesome and efficient so we were able to go anywhere in the city within a matter of minutes. The rooms in the new tower were quiet and clean. The bathroom was really nice with granite counter tops and the shower was a nice size. Everything else was typical Westin quality. The best part is that high speed internet was included in the room rate. This is not the case for most Westins I've stayed at. The only complaint I had was that housekeeping came really late, sometimes after 4:00pm. We sometimes came back to nap during that time, so that got somewhat tricky. Also, housekeeping didn't replace the shampoo or bar soaps. I know they are trying to cut down on waste, but if we have empty shampoo bottles in the shower, they should be replaced. Our rate included buffet breakfast in the restaurant. It was really delicious and there were a lot of choices. The staff was also very friendly. They were all bilingual, so our party not being able to speak French was not a problem. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel. It has everything you expect from a Westin and more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, friendly”
Reviews.Author: louise5678
Reviews.Content: They seem to have ironed out the problems they were having when they opened. Except for the message service, which was only in French so I couldn't set it up, everything went smoothly. Nice smallish pool and sauna. We didn't eat at the restaurant because of its proximity to Old Montreal and terrific restaurants there, but we did have some snacks, and they were fine. Clean, good location, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with young children”
Reviews.Author: BK101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights with our two young boys (ages 4 and 6) on our way up north in Canada. The location is fantastic and within walking distance to Old Montreal and Chinatown. The facility was very modern and clean. The room was spacious and well maintained. What we liked: -They call it the "heavenly bed' and it lives up to the standard. Most comfortable hotel bed I've stayed on and really comfy sheets. -Our package included a buffet breakfast that was above standard. The eggs, toast, etc was standard fair but they had a good selection of smoked salmon, oatmeal, fruits that we enjoyed. -The pools for our young boys was amazing. They loved it and couldn't get enough. The main pool has see through floor which was really cool. There is a hot and cold pool also which our boys enjoyed dipping into to and out of....they supplied kickboards, noodles and some weighted toys for play. There is a nice area between the pools to sit on and just watch the kids or you can just hang out in the pool or the hot pool and relax. -The hotel was so quiet and the rooms were truly blackout which made my boys sleep in much later than they ever do at home. It was one of the quietest rooms we've ever had....no noise from neighboring rooms or above. Things that could be improved: -The service was lacking to make it a top notch five star hotel. There were often long waits to speak to concierge or front desk or even to get someone on the phone. The young man that was the lifeguard at nights was rude and gave alot of attitude when we requested a towel, etc. The other lifeguards were lovely though so it was just one person. -Parking was expensive (about $30CND/night). We stayed in the second tower which made our trip to the pool a bit long but we didn't mind at all. Elevators were fast and operated efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service--Great Room”
Reviews.Author: MacManSaratoga
Reviews.Content: Just returned from montreal and had a wonderful experience at the Westin. The entire hotel was well maintained and modern. Our room was great--especially the sheets and bathroom. The staff was very accomodating and well trained. One of the best hotels I ever stayed in...Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: burberrygirl
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is particular about cleanliness and service. I think this hotel was recently renovated, because everything looked new. It was very clean, great service,great location. They had a pool, a gym facility, and it was right in old Montreal, so there was lots to do nearby. If you are driving, be aware that the parking will cost about $26 a day, but you can move your car in and out as you require, which makes it a bit more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice sized room”
Reviews.Author: TravellinFromCincy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be near Old Montreal. Upon checking into the room, we saw that we were not given 4 sets of towels for our family so, we requested more and they were delivered within 15 mins! The beds were comfy- not too firm. We chose this hotel because of location and there are queen sized beds (Embassy Suites next door only has doubles). There is a metro stop down the street. It felt safe and was very easy to navigate. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. If you go out the back door of the hotel, you end up in Old Montreal. There is a cafe to get breakfast just a few doors away out the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: MLHNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slotted in between downtown and Old Montreal. It is incredibly convenient to walk from the hotel to most of the city. Everyone at this hotel was very professional and helpful. They were great at recommending local restaurants. Physically, the hotel was very pretty and clean. Would definitely recommend it. Only word of caution is the breakfast buffet is over priced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Le Westin Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Travelspirit
Reviews.Content: State at the Le Westin for 3 nights in mid-July and booked it through the Starwood Hotels promo (buy 2 nights, get the 3rd free). They offered us a room in the newest "tower" and the room was spotless, well equipped, and had a partial view of the river. The property was the former Gazette newspaper building and rooms in the other tower include small refrigerators (ours didnt have this, and it might have come in handy although we enjoyed the "newness" of our room, so it was worthwhile to go w/out the refrig). The room was extremely quiet, (we felt like we were the only ones in the building) and we slept like babies on their famous "heavenly bed" system. We are both very sensitive to odors (mold, smoke, dirty a.c. filters, cleaning products) and usually have to enter a hotel room, stand there and "smell' the surroundings, and then find another room due to the reactions we have from these substances (usually a pounding headache or scratchy throat and watery eyes). This was not the case at all in this hotel--the room, lobby, public areas--we experienced no ill reactions anywhere in the hotel. The front desk staff and concierge were extremely helpful and very friendly. If you stop for a moment in the lobby, they rush up and ask how they can help. The metro was directly across the street, and we could walk around Old Montreal and the Port directly from the hotel. The restaurant was very over-priced, especially for the quality of the food. However, the bar within the restaurant offered good drinks at decent prices. My husband accidently left 4 new shirts behind, in the dresser drawer, not realizing it until 9 hours later when we were already in Quebec City. It did take about 8 or 9 phone calls over a 2 day period, but they finallly "located" the shirts and had them overnighted to us, and tried to be as helpful as possible in resolving the situation. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully converted buildings, Relaxing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cgerard
Reviews.Content: Hotel was originally 3 or 4 separate buildings. Very cohesive integration of all into one hotel. I stayed in the St. Jacques tower, which had less natural light in my room due to windows facing other buildings, and having less floors than other tower, however, it was also less crowded--elevators arrived faster and were less full. Service on arrival was very efficient and very friendly. Staff were young and attractive, but without the attitude of similar aged staffs in other hotels I have visited in LAX-SFO-MIA. Well equipped workout room as most Westins have. Large hots tub in pool/wet area. One negative--TV system needed rebooting often. Nothing too bad at all about this 3 day stay. All staff I encountered were friendly and super efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....below Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: BDetec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Westin Hotel for business. Overall it was very satisfactory and i'd stay again. But it had its fair share of problems: No Mini Bar...COME ON WESTIN! I was upgraded on check in as i'm a Starwood Platinum Member, but no Mini Bar and the Exec Lounge wasnt particularly impressive. No Beer or Wine included. Many Westins I've been too have complementary Booze for platinum members, so this was a little disappointing. Room was a corner room but view was frankly crap. Most annoying thing about the hotel was the lifts.....spent 10minute in the lift trying to get to the club lounge and had to go to reception twice to get my room key re coded. New Hotel with teething problems but I would still stay again. Location is great and the staff are very nice. Overall, if recommend it, but its not up to the usual Westin standards im used too. I'd compare it more to a mid-range Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: echo4
Reviews.Content: Stay here, walking distance to everywhere. Rooms are new, Decor is contemporary. Staff is very polite. Go to Bonaparte restaurant (enter through hotel) at 447 st. Francois Xavier, they have prix fixe selections. EXCELLENT French food at affordable prices, quality & ambiance too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a girlfriend weekend.”
Reviews.Author: annabanana245
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I stayed at Le Westin Montreal this past weekend and it was the perfect hotel for our trip. I would not have stayed here without two other people to split the bill as it is more expensive than I would normally pay. However, split three ways its a totally doable option. We could not have asked for a better location! The heart of Vieux Montreal was a five minute walk, and there was a metro station across the street. The room was clean and comfortable. The mattress and bedding were extremely comfortable, though we all felt that the pillows were too plump. The absolute best part of the trip was how helpful and friendly the entire staff is. From check-in to check-out and all hours in between every single employee we encountered was nothing but helpful and professional. For a great nightlife experience try Les Deux Pierrots--it's a great neighborhood pub a five minute walk away. While we were there they had both a band and a solo artist performing. They alternated every hour from 9pm til about 3am. They perform mainly in French but there were quite a few English songs and the atmosphere is lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: august16
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Le Westin. We had a traditional room, which was modern and large. The King size bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was also a nice size, although we did run into some plumbing problems. The shower would not drain. Someone had to come fix it twiceâ€¦and it still did not drain well. The hotel amenities were great. Everything is brand new. Very nice pools, and the workout room was spectacular. The hotel has free wifi, and allows you to print out boarding passes for free ( i read about this being a problem at other hotels). The entire staff was friendly and professional. The concierge was very helpful. We liked the location as it boarders old Montreal and is a few blocks from a subway. Breakfast buffet was 18-21$ per person (we did not have it included in our package). We had it once and I really donâ€™t think it was worth it. Quantity was there, but the quality of the food was lacking. I never stayed in a Westin before, and would certainly not hesitate to do so after such a wonderful stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My family of four just spent the weekend in Montreal at the Westin and it was an excellent experience in every way. Starting with our easy check-in (our room was available early too) everything went smoothly until we departed. All hotel staff we interacted with were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is new and it shows. Lobby and common areas are very nice & modern and the rooms were great. We had 2 extremely comfortable queen beds and the rest of the room was top notch. Shower had a ton of room with dual showerhead and everything was spotlessly clean. No complaints here. The pool/sauna & workout room area was great too. There were 3 different pools at different temperatures which was unique. We also had breakfast included in our rate and it was a good buffet with a nice variety of choices. We appreciated the location of the hotel, right down the street from Old Montreal & Chinatown and a moderate walk to downtown. The metro was also located nearby for easy access to the rest of the city. Overall, we couldn't be happier and when returning to Montreal in the future I will choose the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Housekeeping!!”
Reviews.Author: gasman8181
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, but Front Desk staff very accommodating. A bit of a hike to my room, located in an adjacent tower reached by an escalator and then an elevator. I suspect it might be difficult to reach by persons with disabilities. (My room required a short walk from the elevator as well as a climb down a short stairway - about 8 stairs). Room was clean on arrival. I stayed for 3 nights. Each day of my stay, housekeeping did not arrive until mid to late afternoon to clean my room (After 4 p.m. on the 2nd day). The garbage containers were not emptied at any time (Overflowing by the time I had been there 3 nights). (I could have called to have someone come to empty them, but decided not to, to see if the housekeeping staff would eventually get around to doing it!) Used towels and facecloths were removed from the bathroom on the 2nd day and were not replaced. (Delivered later after a call to the front desk). Glass by the bathroom sink which had been used was not replaced. Overall impression of the hotel was obviously clouded by perhaps the worst housekeeping I have experienced during my years of travel. Other staff (Front Desk, Concierge, etc. were, however, excellent)

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: Gecko007Munich
Reviews.Content: absolute perfection!! more than friendly staff nice location, central and very easy to find. Lots of nice restaurants around. The rooms are perfectly clean and very nice and modern including 42" flatscreens. Breakfastbuffet in very good quality, this is the way how travelling brings a lot of fun, congratulation

Reviews.Title: “tres bon”
Reviews.Author: heeto
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this property and again very enjoyable. Great location- close to Old Montreal,Rue Ste Catherines the other direction,close to underground walkways-nice when the weather is too cold or too hot/humid. Thanks to Marianne at concierge for planning our restaurants. Very clean and quiet rooms.Great beds and large rooms.We've stayed in corner deluxe and premium rooms.Rather odd set ups with wasted space-esp Premium room which has a living room with pullout sofabed seperate from the bedroom.This room was rather dark and uninviting.Next time will stay in standard room which we feel are just as nice. Nice breakfast in hotel reastaurant .Bar at night was ok but not that lively.At one point the TV's were turned up and music off so that everyone had to watch hockey.Montreal wasnt even playing.Not everyone at the bar wants to stare at a loud TV-and I am a huge hockey fan. Would def recommend hotel and will return.Will book standard room and avoid the bland bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were pleasantly surprised with the Westin hotel after a horrible stay at another Starwood hotel, W Hotel, in NYC. Room The room is big and spacious. After fitting in our four huge luggages, there is still room for us to walk around comfortably without knocking ourselves to any fixtures when we go to the toilet in the middle of the night (without the nights on). The bed is comfy and firm. Most important of all, you don't feel it when your partner turned and tossed when you are asleep. The room is well designed even though it has a huge pillar in the room. The pillar does not bother us as it's near the window. Complimentary Wifi Wifi is available anywhere in the hotel. It is also provided complimentary in the rooms. Rates We took advantage of the birth year promotion. Our nightly bill ends up to be less than CAD$100 per night. It's quite a good value considering the quality. Location It can't be any better. It's convinently located and is within walking distance to Chinatown and Old Montreal. You will have no issue looking for food. The nearest subway is just opposite the hotel. Other amenities The gym is huge and has a comprehensive of equipments. The swimming pool is small and have adjacent hot and cold pools. They have a common sauna just besides the pool area. The only complaint They do not provide cotton swaps/ balls or Q-tips in the bathroom. You will need to request for it (which I thought it's kind of troublesome considering it's one of the common items that you will find in a bathroom). Parking We did not use the parking in the hotel. Apparently, it's rather expensive. We decided to park our car just a block down the road when it's free (from 10pm till 9am). There is also public parking space available near the hotel (if you don't mind walking a couple of minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service falls short of Westin standard”
Reviews.Author: Becksman
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms and close to many attractions in Vieux Montreal. It has the making of a great 5 star hotel. However, service was not up to expectations of a Westin. Went there for a conference and it was pouring rain on the first day. To my surprise, they did not even have an umbrella for me. Hotels of this class usually have one in each room! Housekeeping needs improvement too. Dirty glasses were left in room with no fresh ones provided and staff were very impersonal. Linens were rough. Don't know what happened to 'Heavenly Beds'... On the good side, the hotel has excellent conference facilites and the food was good (by conference standard).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, specials deals worthwhile.”
Reviews.Author: zoda99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Westin and were generally pleased. It is a new hotel and is in a great location (we walked everywhere). The staff is nice and helpful and the rooms well appointed. The gym is new and was always empty. One concern is the cleanliness of the common areas leave something to be desired. There was a huge coffee stain/puddle that remained on our foyer table for all 4 days we were there. Also the pool had horrible hours and was usually not open when we wanted to go. That aside I would recommend the hotel. You can get good deals for around $120-$150.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Modern Choice in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: joshua_78Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 friends at Le Westin May 28th to 31st. We stayed at the Intercontinental right beside this hotel last year, and I must say the Westin is cheaper and provides so much more value. Use their "Birth year" promotion... it will save you hundreds of dollars if you are staying 2 or 3 nights. The location of this hotel is situated right on the border of Old Montreal. It's hilarious that you can walk out the back door of the hotel and be in Old Montreal, with all the beautiful buildings and cobblestone streets... or go out the front door and find a busy metropolis with a food court right across the street. We LOVED the glass bottom pool, they even gave us goggles so we could stare at the people checking us out below. Hilarious! The room we had was decent sized with a really ugly view of a wall. Thank goodness for window blinds and a good imagination. 4 adults were in there quite comfortably though. The rooms had no fridges (we put ourselves on a wait list the first day, but still didn't get one one by the 3rd day) and we constantly needed to call housekeeping for more towels. Only 2 bath towels were provided per day. For 4 people, that just wouldn't do. Internet is free in the rooms, but we never used it. Hotel feels very large, modern and clean. Room service was delicious. Service from all staff was always quick and efficient. We felt safe everywhere we went in this neighborhood. Would recommend this hotel to anyone mainly for the location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Mishafrisky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for a girls shopping trip in Montreal. Very modern hotel with amazingly comfortable beds. Only downfalls were- odd hours of the pool, and poor concierge service. We would recommend staying here but not using the concierge- they booked us for a pedicure but provided us the wrong time, and were very slow in dealing with any questions. Other than that, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to hotel in MTL. Love the new Westin!”
Reviews.Author: murphadelix
Reviews.Content: The best part about Le Westin is its location. Close enough to downtown that you can walk to tons of shops and restaurants, but just far enough from the crowds that you don't have to wait 2 hours for a table at the local Eggspectation. And Old Montreal is so gorgeous. Valet is affordable and staff at reception are super-nice. Concierge was very helpful and made a number of suggestions for retaurants and walks nearby. Decor is regular Westin, though I would say the rooms are a bit bigger than usual. On my second stay here I was in the St-Jacques Tower, which is the old Montreal Gazette building - truly beautiful and less generic than the main tower. And there's only about 10 rooms per floor, so it's very quiet and private. It can be really confusing to find your way over there though, so make sure you pay attention to the check-in staff when they draw you the map of the escalator/elevator/corridor combos to get to your room! There's also a very yummy breakfast buffet offered at The Reporter, which I've never seen at a Westin before, but really appreciated! Lots of options, and really fresh. Came once for romance and once with friends and loved loved loved it both times. Le Westin is my new default home in MTL.

Reviews.Title: “Strange hours for swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Elisabetd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights here for Montreal Symphony Concerts. Good location for the hall, and also for China Town and Metro for a visit to the Botanical Garden. Very helpful for that. However the glass bottom swimming pool that was one of the reasons for picking that hotel is only open 7-11am, and 5-9pm. These are not the hours I like to swim, that I do in the afternoon. I did not even realize the pool was not open and went swimming, and after a while a manager came and asked me to leave. Very disappointing, and should be listed in their website. Also the pool is small and the water cold. The hot tub has no waves, it is just a pool.

Reviews.Title: “First at a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Chillinathtown
Reviews.Content: Nice property. Somewhat luxury at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdsouza
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean. The bathroom was amazing and the location was even better. They even gave us a bottle of wine and a card for our anniversary. 1 thing that i would recommend is having a gift store in the hotel and vending machines. A+ i would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav147
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel, friendly staff, luxurious and brand-new rooms, liked the bathroom, the bed heavenly indeed, delicious chocolates to help relax and sleep (where can I order them?) in the evening as part of turndown service, very good breakfast (among other things, fresh strawberries and other fruit) and coffee. When you exit the hotel on the 3rd floor on the back you are immediately in the Old Town, very handy. The only thing I missed was a minibar in the room. Strange for such a luxurious hotel (I guess it's Westin policy, because I stayed in Westin Reston last year and there was also no minibar). There are ice cubes in the rooms however (which I don't use). I wonder why this hotel scores so low on tripadvisor. To me it was almost perfect and I'm very picky normally.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelShopGirlVT
Reviews.Content: Really just a perfect new addition to Montreal! Hopefully the hotel's TripAdvisor rating will improve shortly, because it deserves it! I lost my personal photo's of the room, however, the hotel website photos of the rooms are actually accurate! The rooms are huge, and the heavenly beds are really top notch!

Reviews.Title: “24 hours at Le Westin, Montreal afforded us a marvelous getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Fairmont5
Reviews.Content: Our family of five were looking for a hotel in Old Montreal. Having stayed in various hotels in Montreal, we were very discriminating. The hotel staff suggested we upgrade to a premium room to accommodate our growing family . We were delighted by the extra space, the furnishings, the comfortable Heavenly beds, the terrific breakfast, the three temperature pools and the valet parking. We had a view towards the river and it was a quick walk to LeCirque's Totem.The staff were very accommodating and friendly. We felt very much at home and appreciated the access to the old port, the convenience to the shops and metro. This will be our family's destination of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaBabyAR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the Westin Montreal over Easter weekend. The hotel check in was easy - we got there around 9 pm ... not too many people around. First thing I noticed was that the lobby was warm. Checked in, headed upstairs and the room was also burning up. The AC helped but both nights were were warm and kicked the blankets off the bead. The room was a good size, partial view of the Notre Dame. The bathroom needed to be larger. My husband came into the bathroom to grab a hand towel while I was in the shower and left the bathroom door open - it literally blocked my way out of the shower. Not a big deal, but I usually like to fall asleep with the TV or a movie on - no movies on demand. Hotel is in a good location to the metro, sights and restaurants. Had the hotel book us a car back to the airport - good service, on time and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wakky_J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at le Westin Montreal 3 times in March for business. Good location for the conference centre and old Montreal but not ideal for the business district. Stayed anyway because I liked the rooms better than Sheraton le centre and they had an SPG promotion. It's a newer hotel so the rooms are all good-sized with modern amenities including flat screen tv and ipod dock. The bathroom is also nice and big but shower only - no bathtub. Exercise area was decent with a pool and all the exercise equipment was new and in good condition. Food in the restaurant is quite good and significantly better than Sheraton le centre. Room included free internet and free hot buffet breakfast which was actually a very nice breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. Nothing mind-blowing or fancy about the place but a good solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Very nice hotel, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with to the family during March 2010. The hotel is very nice, modern and clean, the staff were very polite (A+). Its in a very good location, a few blocks from old Montreal and 2 blocks from the metro (subway), and about 2 km from downtown (two metro stops). They only have valet parking for $26/day but are close to many of the major attractions and the metro is a great way to get around. The room was very spacious and clean, the washroom had a very large standup shower and no bathtub (I actually prefer it that way). I'd recommend this hotel but there were a few small issues. We stayed 3 nights and were woken up because of noise during two of those nights. One of them was an idiot banging on a door (hardly the hotel's fault) but the other has to do with their building, we could clearly hear the people walking around in the room above us. They didn't seem to be jumping or anything, but for some reason the ceiling/floor is not well sound insulated so we heard them walking (enough to prevent us from sleeping well). They have a pool and they advertise it as having a glass floor, which is true, but its a very small pool (probably about 12' x 25'), so its ok for taking a dip but too small to exercise in or for the kids to enjoy. They have a gym with a decent equipment which is open 24 hours/day. Oh yeah, its right across the street from the convention center. Overall I'd recommend this hotel and I'd go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ShinerDraft
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip in the Montreal area, so I went a few days early & took my wife to spend the weekend. We stayed at Le Westin and enjoyed it very much. It's in a nice, quiet spot. I really liked the location. You can walk to the busy spots on St Catherine, or take a stroll over to Old Montreal & the port area. There are two metro stations close by. The closest is accessible if you just walk across the street to the northwest corner of the Palais des Congres building. The other is about two blocks away near Square Victoria. From either of those, it's easy to get to the Eaton Center or wherever else you need to go. The hotel itself was very nice. Comfortable beds & everything was very clean. The staff was very helpful & friendly (and they put up with our poor attempts at French). We were also very appreciative that they held on to our luggage for a few hours after we checked out. This allowed us to go get a massage & have an early dinner before moving to the hotel across town that I had to stay at for my business meeting later in the week. The room was spacious & clean. The bed was comfortable. They had a nice flatscreen TV with several HD channels. We had a very nice, roomy walk in shower. I had a little bit of trouble with the internet access at one point, but they have tech support available (above & beyond front desk people) and they were able to get the problem fixed in about 7 or 8 minutes. The only drawback was the lack of a fridge & microwave. Also, the pool and access to the underground tunnels were closed during our visit. Aside from some good deals that we've gotten on the deep discount sites, this is probably the best value I've ever gotten in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel - felt like a millionaire”
Reviews.Author: Regislive
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing right from the moment you pull into the hotel. Nice modern and contempory hotel. The staff is amazing I was treated like I was someone very important! It's nice for a change to stay someone where they want you. The room was wonderful with a great view of the St. Lawerence. The pool and workout area were amazing. The pool has a glass bottom over the front entrance it's cool! The metro was right across the street so nice easy access. Also there is a back entrance on the 3rd floor that will take you right out to 'OId Montreal'. A very nice touch! Also you feel very secure everywhere. You need your key card to get in the back entrance and to use the elevator. The front entrance always has a ton of staff around. Also the parking garage can only be accessed by the valet staff. Like I said very safe and secure. I can't say enough about this hotel. I only hope next time I goto Montreal I can get another good deal on staying here. It looks like it should cost over $300 a night but it didn't!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: lamome108
Reviews.Content: As a platinum member was given a lovely corner room with a good view. Both the bed and linens were perfect, Starwood beds are always a sure thing. Nice big shower in a well-lit bathroom. It is very interesting to walk around the hotel (both inside and out) and observe the transformation that has taken place. Front desk staff were efficient if not a bit cold attitude (think Air Canada check in agents: ''passport, credit card, thank you, bye''). Housekeeping staff and valets were friendly. The in-house restaurant (the Gazette) has a nice breakfasts. Both the pool and the Club Lounge were closed during my visit. The gym is great, a variety of machines and some with personal LCD TVs which is a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: bunny2LondonUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday evening around 6pm, and were greeted by a LONG line waiting to check in. We waited almost an hour before reaching the head of the line, and were then told that due to the loate check out of a large group there were no rooms ready. No apology from the check-in supervisor who did not once make eye contact, even when he told us we would have to wait a further 45minutes to an hour. Really poor customer service. Once we got to our room, it was classic Westin fit out, comfortable bed, noce big shower, though the room had a view onto a brick wall 5 feet away. Breakfast was good. This would be a nice hotel, if only the Reception management would get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: anthonydean
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, very modern, quiet, great food, great room. LOVED IT !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rhea1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin on a discounted rate. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel foyer and reception area were well-presented and welcoming. We were able to exchange up to USD$100 at reception without a fee. The hotel was downtown and closet to transit and the underground network. Notre Dame Church, Old Montreal and the port only a few minutes walk. The valet service is expensive, you can park across the road for about $20. Our room was wonderful, very clean with a great double shower head. The towels a fluffy and you the bathrobes are good fun. Complete bathroom accessories (soap, shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash). My brother forgot his razor and toothbrush and was provided with both plus a small can of shaving cream and toothpaste. We also needed a screwdriver to adjust our snowboard bindings and they managed to find one in less than 10 minutes! The beds were high and comfy with the choice of four pillows so you can always find the best fit for you. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be better”
Reviews.Author: tripmon
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it was because it was Christmas but the staff seemed kind of cold (except for Maryann who was very helpful via E-mail prior to the trip). The rooms were clean and nice but the fact the they charge for internet access was an insult. We stayed at what could be seen as lower level type hotels and getting your boarding pass printed was always free. They wanted to charge .49c a minute for this at this Westin. This made the visit feel "Cheap". Punk move on a better brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: The Westin Montreal is located in the old Gazette building, where they used to print the Montreal Gazette. I'm old enough to remember. The hotel itself is beautiful: nice lobby, large clean bright rooms, excellent bathroom with lighted mirrors and great shower, great beds. Service was impeccable, and rates were reasonable around Christmas 2009. Parking is pricey, but that is true of most hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jparker1153
Reviews.Content: The Westin of Montreal is a beautiful peace of property located in the heart of Montreal. I was there on business and had a great stay. The room was very fairly priced and for such a nice hotel you can't go wrong. The hotel is brand new and finely appointed. I really enjoyed the staffs willingness to help. Great Hotel...Great Stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachPaul
Reviews.Content: As a regular at the W Montreal, I thought I'd try this starwood sister down the street. I was not dissapointed. This Westin is brand new, and it's rates are insanely low. I was upgraded upon check in, and my room was perfect. I just love the heavenly beds! The gym was a really nice surprise, seeing as it was actually well equiped. The breakfast buffet was really nice too.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cruising on a sailboat in FL Keys
Reviews.Title: “Is this a Westin Lite or a Four Points in disguise?”
Reviews.Author: DocFraud
Reviews.Content: The staff of this property is pleasant, polite and professional. It is therefore unfortunate that the designers of the hotel have made some very poor choices which in my opinion will doom it to failure. Westin regulars will notice that finishes and furnishings look like Westin appointments, but are of a quality more befitting a lesser chain. The very thin dark veneers of the contemporary furniture are already showing signs of wear despite the property being open for less than a year. When we checked in, as a Starwood Platinum, we were given an upgrade to a room on the 21st floor. Since the property was no where near full, I expected at least a junior suite. What I got, was a smallish room with a king bed, a 42 inch LCD TV and a good desk. The bathroom was small with a single bowl granite vanity and a large walk in shower cabinet equipped with the two headed Heavenly Shower. There was no tub. If I was traveling on business, the room would have been fine for a 1-2 night stay. I was however in town for the weekend with my wife, so I called the front desk to inquire about an upgrade to a larger room. The front desk manager was very receptive to my requests and made arrangements for us to be moved to a â€œpremiumâ€� room on the 14th floor, which has a separate sitting area in addition to the regular room. The bell staff took care of transferring our luggage while we were out and the new keys were waiting for us when we returned to the hotel later in the evening. Since the transfer went so well, it was a disappointment bordering on shock when we opened the door to our â€œpremium roomâ€� and switched on the light. We found ourselves staring at a pile of our luggage in a room that looked like a storage area for furniture. The room was lit with a single overhead fixture that contained a low wattage energy saver fluorescent bulb that seemed to amplify the starkness of the fact that our â€œsitting areaâ€� had no windows; no supplemental lighting of any sort and nothing on the walls except for the neutral wallcovering, which under the low wattage light appeared slightly green. It was an â€œoh my godâ€� moment, but not in a good way. The premium room on the â€œSPG Floorâ€� may have had slightly more floor area, but the smaller windows, and large amounts of wasted space due to building structures made it seem smaller than our previous room on the 21st floor, which was at least brighter. The bathroom was smaller and was not equipped with the Heavenly Shower, and we were not provided with shower gel or mouth wash. During our stay we encountered sticking door locks, faulty thermostats, and very slow to heat hot water, but we can attribute these deficiencies as the teething pains of a new property. All of our issues were addressed very quickly and professionally. Having seen the â€œupgradedâ€� rooms on the 21st and the â€œpremiumâ€� rooms on the 14th however it is highly likely that I will not return to this property, unless a suitable alternative is not available. The facilities are simply not worthy of the Westin label and I do not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: asd_md
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend with my wife, hotel location is pretty amazing, right near downtown core. After you get there pretty much anything is within walking distance. Got a great deal with flight from West jet. Hotel was still under construction so the pool was not open yet, but the rooms are fairly large, quiet and well decorated. Bathroom is also very nice, with higher end finishes. Overall great room for the value, would def. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of new hotel hiccups, but great value and a beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl7217
Reviews.Content: Best rate in the city by $75 per night. A brand new hotel - everything was very clean. The room was beautiful (great beds and bedding, large, well appointed, excellent bathroom), the buffet breakfast was great, and the public spaces were lovely. The gym was the best in-hotel gym I've seen - the equipment was state of the art. On the downside staff communication didn't seem the best - the front desk gave us coupons for the bar (because the Club was closed) and the bar staff didn;t seem to know what they were. The in-room movies aren't in place yet - annoying when travelling with kids. But all in all this would be our first choice next time we go to Montreal if the rate was right. Great location, too - couple of blocks from the harbour in one direction, couple of blocks from St. Catherines in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Overvalued,very poorly managed, shouldn't be a Westin”
Reviews.Author: vincebilodeau
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Montreal for two nights during labor day weekend. The hotel was somehow crowded and although I asked a high floor room and checked in at around 1pm, they weren't able to find a room higher then the 3rd floor. Obviously we got waken up early in the morning since there is a lot of traffic noise coming from St-Antoine st. Staff at the reception was a total disapointment, rude, indolent and wouldn't speak to me in french (do feel more comfortable speaking french). Also, when we checked-in our room, I checked the sheets to make sure they were new (as I always do) and I found some red stains that looked like lipstick on it. We also got surprised when we asked for bathrobes and that the delivery man, about 7 seconds after knocking on the door, got into the room although the do not disturb sign was on the door, this shows how well managed this hotel is... On the plus side, they brought (after two requests), a nice dog bed for our pet (30$ a night). Beds are also very comfortable. Very limited selection for room service. Won't return..

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Clean and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1213Tx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for 3 nights in early August. It was brnad new and very clean and fresh. The staff tried top b helpful but being that it just opened there were a few glitches...but we still enjoyed it. The buffet breakfst was great and the location was good. It was right across from the convention center and a short walk to the old streets of Old Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Good Luxury Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: co_fragment
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel in the center of Montreal, on the edge of the old town and a short walk to the city center shops. Had a great room, with a nice view up to Mont Royal. Clean, modern, spacious, very comfortable beds, well equipped bathroom, cable TV, AC, etc. Seen gripes about the staff on here, but they seemed fine to me. I can't vouch for the price as I didn't pay and I didn't eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New -- very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: prpro70
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd expect in a new Westin property. Perfect for business travel, even though it is about a 10 min taxi ride from downtown or for a couples getaway. Service was personable. Rooms are brand new and fresh. The hotel is so comfortable and pleasant. Excellent room service for breakfast. Get the yogurt parfait and fruit platter-- heavenly. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Go now before more people find out that it has opened!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beds! lousy front desk personnels”
Reviews.Author: canuck38
Reviews.Content: great location, very clean, renovation done, best beds in all of the hotels that we've stayed in...and we've stayed in many.....not very helpful front desk people, especially this one guy...we wanted to extend our stay one more nite at the same rate and i didn't like the condescending tone of speech...no smiles...I said i needed a cab to one woman and she just asked me to flag one on the street....i asked the same to the porter and bellboy outside and they were so helpful in calling a cab for me...and even recommended restaurants for me to go to when I asked....they were much much more friendlier than the so called "friendly staff at the desk".....and the nice Korean lady who was the part-time lifeguard there was very personable and also gave me ideas for food.....oh internet is 49 cents a minute!!! forgot to mention, the cleaning lady was so nice that she even folded my daughter's clothes left on the sofa!!

Reviews.Title: “still underconstruction”
Reviews.Author: anakinNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed Le Westin Montreal on 9/4 and 9/5. We were really looking forward to staying at your place because we heard that this hotel place is bland new, and we really enjoyed stay at Westin hotel when we lived in Japan. However, we had a miserable night at Le Westin Montreal. First, after we checked in, a porter lost my wife's jacket while he brought our baggage to our room, but he never admit that and claimed that she had left it in the car. My wife went to "lost and found" by herself and found it. It turned out that the porter had dropped her jacket on the hallway and somebody had found it. Second, this hotel is still under construction. There were tons of tools everywhere. The pool looked good, but the changing room was not ready. no shower and no locker there. The water was so cold and we couldn't stay there more than 10 minutes. Third and most importantly, the service was awful. We came back from the pool to our room shivering with cold and we wanted to take a shower in our room, but we could find bath towels. I asked room service to bring them, but they never came. I had to make a call to room service three times (we had to wait for 2hrs) To make it worse, no hot water came out. So I send an email and complained, and I got auto email reply saying "we will give you extra starwood points for your inconvenience". We have decided never ever choose Westin for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Westin Chain a Bad Name”
Reviews.Author: profwendy
Reviews.Content: We got a really good price for the Westin, and that is probably b/c they have trouble attracting customers w/all of their problems. They can't get basic things right like refilling the coffee service, cups in the bedroom, or say, hot water (we had none for 2 days--which they compensated for w/a day of free parking at least). The staff seemed apologetic and nice, but they can't do anything about the fact that the hotel is so strangely built; if you get a cheap rate, you'll be in the short tower, which is an escalator ride and about .5 mile away from everything; the fact that it's not busy enough to sustain a bar that stays open; or that the hotel is in the middle of a sterile part of a city, a part of the city that feels and looks surprisingly dead. One great thing: the bed was heavenly at least, and for the most part, it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Response to problems”
Reviews.Author: auntzurg
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Westin and the bed was fabulous. We had a few service blips, but each time the hotel staff handled everything extremely well. They definitely have some kinks to work out but I feel in time it should be a fabulous hotel. Make sure to eat at the hotel restaurant the Gazette for dinner. We had a fabulously delicious dinner. The appetizer of mushrooms with polenta was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great new Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tokalosh
Reviews.Content: Despite reports of poor service at this recently opened hotel we decided to try it having been very satisfied with Westin Hotels elsewhere. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Service was excellent...no problems at all. The rooms are on the large side and have the usual Heavenly Beds and Shower. Location is perfect on the outskirts of the old city. (There is a back entrance that enters directly into the old city ). Buffet breakfast was included. Plenty to eat and high quality. Fruit was outstanding. Located conveniently on the Metro for those who do not have a car or want to avoid Montreal's horrific traffic congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Glutenfree_girls_2
Reviews.Content: August 11-14, 2009 - My husband recently had to go for a training in Montreal. The kids and I tagged along- ages 13, 5, and 4 weeks old. I chose the Westin based on being new and I thought the kids would like the pool (it has glass bottom panels that allow you to look below to the entry way of the hotel). We did the opening special which was $209 per night and included valet parking and breakfast for the 4 of us. (I think I heard that the price of the buffet breakfast alone was around $20 per person, so this deal was quite the savings!) The room- When we walked in to our room on the 16th floor, we thought it was beautiful. An oversized hotel room, with 2 heavenly beds (very comfy), a large desk, 2 chairs and side table. Lots of room for the 5 of us to move about. The view out of the huge window was of the city. It was a gorgeous view! The drapes on the window blocked out so much light that my kids slept in and had to be awakened at 930 every morning. You would have thought with how dark it stayed with the drapes pulled that it was night time - this was a very good thing, no peeping sun in the morning! The bathroom was large with a very large walk in shower. The vanity was granite and overall the lighting in the bathroom was very bright. The only bad thing is that they didn't have refrigerators yet. The bellman said that they would be getting them and there was a place for them in the dresser drawers cabinet. The place was very clean and housekeeping was more than accomodating. The service-Not speaking any French had me concerned as I heard that this may be a problem for us. Not so, everyone was very friendly to us and most in the city as well as the hotel spoke decent English. We had trouble getting our laptop to connect to the free high speed, and the front desk was very helpful with connecting us to the people to get it working. Within 5 minutes we were able to access the internet. Also, the concierege was very helpful in pointing out areas of interest and the best routes to get there. The location- This hotel is within walking distance to the pier and about 4 or so blocks away from the Notre Dame Basilica. The metro was right across the street. This hotel is located in Old Montreal. The pool- Although very small, it was great for the kids. There were also 2 "hot tubs" on the other side of the pool, but because all of the water was soooo cold, they were more like small pools. The kids would shower to get warm and then run and get into the pool. We never found out if there was a problem with the heater, but construction was still going on in the building close to the pool area. Construction- We did hear some construction noises but not until about 9 am and never in the evening. This was not a problem for us. Parking- It is all valet parking! I think it was $20 or so per day, but we had it included in our package. It only took about 5 minutes for us to get our car when we needed it! Quick service. Restaurant- This was a 4 or 5 star restaurant and had a wonderful breakfast buffet with everything you could want. The omelets were the best! Room service was very expensive, but isn't it always? Very good food though and only about 30 minutes wait. Dinner was very good and we received coupons for buy one entree get 1/2 off of the second along with kids eat free coupons when we checked in. We still spent $40 with tip included, but it was very delicious food with excellent service as the restaurant was pretty empty at 7 pm. Overall impression - Even though this was a very nice hotel, there were lots of families there. You would have never known it though because the hallways were very quiet! It seemed as though we were the only ones there (but we saw our neighbors going into their rooms a few times). I am very picky in my taste for hotels I stay at and this one definitely met and exceeded my expectations. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would stay there again if I ever go back to Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel across from convention center”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel and decor are really lovely and the rooms very large!! We were just getting our Montreal sea legs however and I would comment that while it is equi-distant to both Old Montreal and St. Catherine, it is really not super close to either (15-20 minute walk). It really is located super conveniently across from the convention center which was not of interest to us. With that said, the hotel value was fantastic and the breakfast amazing!!! The hotel was very busy with all types of travelers and they did a great job accommodating all of the needs. Best features: large lovely clean rooms and wonderful breakfast in a hip urban environment.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Hotel for a Beer Budget”
Reviews.Author: justin5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Montreal. The Le Westin is still under a little construction, I only saw a few things and none had any impact on our stay. I traveled with my wife and 4 yr daughter. We book a standard king room and I brought a inflatable mattress with us for the little one. However I was the one that ended up in it. The rooms where larger than average and brand new and very clean, a nice double shower in the bathroom too. I have stayed in a lot of hotels that cost alot more and where no where near as nice. Great location just a block from Notre Dame Church, We didnt eat at the hotel and followed recommendations for eggspectations just around the corner, breakfast was really good. Do not eat at Le Pyrennes, the carriage ride guy that took us for a ride recommended this place and it was horrible. The Bad, The bar closed at 12 each night we where there, the pool was a little cold for me too.

Reviews.Title: “Worderful hotel, #1 choice in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ChichiPR
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 4 nights in July and we loved this hotel. We were somewhat skeptical because of the previous reviews but were pleasantly surprised. From the service to the location, this hotel is a great choice. The staff was extremely helpful and the rooms were spacious, clean and nicely decorated. We arrived after a 5 hour drive, and were supposed to drop off the rental car at the airport. The young man who greeted us suggested we drop it off at a location near the hotel, so we would save the 45 minute drive and the taxi fare when returning to the hotel. He called the company himself and made the arrangement. We met with him later in the lobby and he gave us wonderful restaurant suggestions. It turns out he was the food and beverages manager at the hotel. It goes to show how much effort they are putting into service, when the food and beverages manager pitches in wherever he is needed. The location is hard to beat. We walked everywhere and after a long day our daughters enjoyed the glass bottom pool. Very unique indeed. We highly recommend this hotel when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready For Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: madper
Reviews.Content: In time, say 6 to 9 months, this facility may be ready for service. Until then I would suggest you try another property. As a Starwood member, we usually select a Westin where available because of the outstanding service provided. However, this hotel is far below the high standards of The Westin. There are so many problems with this hotel that it is difficult to know where to begin. Rarely have I ever written a critical review of a Westin Hotel. The facility has great po- tential but is not ready for prime time. I has opened far too early with inadequate training of staff, completion of work in progress, and poor design. Several previous reviews have mentioned some of the difficulties they have encountered e.g., poor concierge service, lack of adequate staff, inconsistent service, long waits to gain "access" to your car even after paying over $25 a night for parking. My wife and I love Montreal and Quebec, appreciating the people and the culture; but this hotel does not give a good first impression of such a wonderful city. We travel to Quebec for pleasure often and have never been disappointed. Management really needs to take note in a very serious way the needs that are to be met. While I received an apology from the hotel for the poor service, that is fine but it won't "cut it" if this is not addressed. While the few staff we dealt with were very pleasant and did the best they could under the circumstances, smiles and kind gestures need to be met with service. At this point, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends. Perhaps in another 6 to 12 months, with a hit and miss here and there, this facility may be ready for "prime time".

Reviews.Title: “Le Westin Montreal is the best!”
Reviews.Author: linbe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending two nights in Montreal at the newly opened Westin. It was fantastic! We were greeted at the door by a very pleasant parking valet who whisked our car away, while another valet carried our luggage into the hotel. The hotel lobby is breathtaking as is the decor throughout, including the restaurant, bar and our room. Every staff member that we encountered spoke flawless english and made us feel very welcome. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, good location, not quite finished.”
Reviews.Author: bjsetegn
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in early August. Everyone there was very helpful and the hotel is located in a very convenient location in Montreal. It is a brand new hotel and is somewhat trendy and well designed. Several problems came up over our stay. First there weren't refrigerators in every room. We order one from the front desk but they were all taken. They put us on a waiting list but we never received a fridge. Also the wireless internet was broken on our floor. We couldn't find any do not disturb signs and were constantly being bothered by the cleaning staff. While there is a pool in the building it is rather small. The heater for the pool was broken during our stay and the general pool area is not all that nice. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless I was 100% certain all of these problems were fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, clean, pleasant stay, wouldn't stay anywhere else upon returning to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: brett31m
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were a bit hesitant to book this hotel after reading reviews of incompleteness, elevator malfunction, etc. But, we ended up booking a standard room, king size bed, for our two night/three day mini-vacation to Montreal. It was one of the better experiences I have had while traveling. To begin, the location is WONDERFUL. If you walk one way, you are at Old Montreal/Notre Dame Cathedral, and if you walk the other way, you are downtown, right on Sainte Catherine street. It seemed to be only a max of 20 minutes from anything and everything. We have extremely high standards for dining, and every restaurant we went to (each within comfortable walking distance of the hotel) was outstanding. The GPS brought us right to the entrance of the hotel on Sainte Antoine street, and we had the car valeted. We had booked through hotels.com, and since I brought a copy of the confirmation email, check-in was easy. We received two keys for the 15th floor. Upon arriving in the room, we were pleased with the simple, elegant decor complete with a flat screen TV, and an iHome speaker/clock radio. After two nights I can say that the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Everything was extremely clean and new! We had brought some juice and beverages to have in the hotel and were a bit surprised to find that there was no mini-fridge. However, we called concierge for some ice buckets and they were brought up promptly by an employee. This ended up making the drinks colder even quicker, so it ended up working out nicely. For $142 a night, this was super comfortable, clean, and a great location. It would be great for a businessman as well as it would be great for a family vacation. I would ONLY stay here if and when I return to Montreal! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JGMotek
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week at this hotel while attending a conference at the Palais de Congres across the street.The hotel was also in easy walking distance of the Notre Dame basilica and Old Montreal. Thanks to my husband's Starwood Gold status, we were upgraded to the club lounge level. (We had also signed up for a great pre-paid deal, where every other night was half-price.) Our room was fantastic: comfy beds, double-headed stall shower, good blackout shades. The workout facilities were open and provided various machines, plus a pool. The only sign we had that the hotel was still not complete were workmen around during the day (although we didn't hear them in the morning) and the elevators malfunctioned a couple of times. However, I would highly recommend this hotel: the room was great and the staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, still not ready”
Reviews.Author: nebularis
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at this new Westin property in Old Montreal. There still seems to be a bit of work left to do to make it an inviting hotel experience. The style is very nice, I liked the grand entrance and the glass bottom pool. The room was fairly spacious and well appointed, very nice bathroom with glass door shower and very comfortable Queen-size beds. You can tell the hotel is not ready yet because: lack of signage!! I had no idea how to get to my room! The hotel is very big and feels like a maze! There are two "towers" in this hotel -- I was in the rear tower. To get to my room, I needed to climb the escalator to the restaurant/lounge level, then find the elevator -- of which there were several. The first bank of elevators I tried, nearest to the escalators, brought me up to an open and unfinished space which was definitely not my floor. It looked like unfinished convention or office space, which was strangely unrestricted to curious or lost guests. When I returned to the lounge level, a security guard approached me and instructed me to go down another hall to find the correct elevator. On my floor, I also noticed a number of rooms with sheets of paper taped to the door with room numbers on them, and boxes of materials (light bulbs, signs, etc) just sitting around. Trying to find the pool/fitness room, involved going down the elevator to the lounge level, walking through the lounge area, and going up another set of elevators in the other tower. Again, no signage, so I had to guess where these other elevators were and what floor the pool was on. Some travel tips... the Metro is just across the street at the Palais des Congres. You can also park there for half of what the hotel charges for parking. There is an Eggspectation restaurant around the back of the hotel, where you can get a good breakfast or lunch for a fraction of what the hotel's restaurant charges. Aside from the problems experienced -- which I can overlook now that I've explored and figured out where everything is -- the staff were very polite and helpful for any questions I had or issues I couldn't resolve on my own. I'd like to see what this place will look like in another 6-12 months from now, after these issues have (hopefully) been corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was okay, but still has a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: Robins44
Reviews.Content: As previously posted, there is still no fridge in the room, the hardware on the dresser fell off and the elevators in the main tower are slow. The main problem with the elevators was in the morning and the evenings (around dinner time) during the weekends. There are only 3 elevators to service the main wing and, even thou the floors aren't that big, the elevators are always busy. During the week days we didn't have this problem with the elevators. The snack shop in the lobby had very little of offer and you had to go to the front desk to pay for your items. This was a real turnoff, especially when there was a long line of guests waiting to register. Also, there are no ice machine on the floor, so I called the operator to have someone bring up some ice. After about 20 minutes, I had to call again about the ice. Another 10 minutes went by and, finally, the ice arrived. The pool and fitness center were open, but there is still work needed in the immediate area (i.e. the bathrooms). Overall, the room was nice and clean. We didn't have to wait that long at check in and the location is great, close to Old Montreal, but the hotel still has some issues that it needs to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, but overall let-down”
Reviews.Author: Letustrade
Reviews.Content: Great location & great staff - friendly and helpful. But there are things that spoil the overall experience in this hotel which is out of the control of the staff. Whoever designed this hotel should not be designing another one. First of all, the drive-in drop-off area is too small - put 3 big cars and a taix in there, and you have urself a traffic jam. It is much better to park temporarily on the street to unload - kinda defeat the purpose of staying at this luxury hotel. During check-in checkout times, despite the valet/bell boys working flat out, it still takes 50 min to get my car out of the carpark. C'mon Westin, we are paying $26 for the valet - at least provide some service. This is not a matter of valet/bell boys being lazy (they aren't), but a matter of having a better system. Same goes to the checkin checkout counter - you should expect a longggggg queue during "peak" hours. Express checkout solves part of the problem. 2nd bad design: if your room is in another tower at the back, you have to haul your luggage from the lobby up the lift or escalator one floor up, then haul it 100 metre to another lift, then haul it up to your floor. 3rd bad design: the king bed room is tiny with hardly any room to move. Trying to squeeze so much furniture in is stupid. Switching on all 3-4 lights in the room still does not provide adequate lighting - but I guess some people like the room dim. The light surrounding the ensuite bathroom mirror is nice but stupid - it is too glarey to the eyes. Everything used in the room is genuinely good stuff though, from linen to toileteries to the heavenly bed. The room is also very well-made up each morning. But, if you're paying that much, you'd expect that much. So, overall, it's a good hotel, but I won't go there again just because there are too many little things that add up to spoil the overall experience. For similar price, you have heaps of options around town. But if the helpful and smiley staff makes your day, then go ahead and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Still not ready for primetime...”
Reviews.Author: nroffman
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the reviews saying that this hotel has worked out it's kinks, anyone there this past Sunday (when the elevators were all broken again and the valet area was a complete disaster) would disagree. The rooms themselves are large and nice and ready for guests, at least for the most part, but the property as a whole still seems like it hasn't undergone a final check through with Starwood, in preparation for actually opening. As a result, as with any franchise, it kind of tarnishes the brand as a whole. The underlying problem we witnessed over four days was a management/manpower one: this property needs desperately a competent general manager and then it needs to hire many more workers, especially on weekends. The staff we encountered were helpful and great but there just weren't enough of them. This caused a horrible tie up in the valet area with guests waiting an hour for their cars and an employee passing out from being overworked. This also caused long check-in lines and in actuality no real dedicated concierge, as they were expected to check people in, too. As for the elevators, the property should act like the airlines and give some sort of credit to anyone staying there when they are broken. It really isn't fun carrying kids up dozens of flights of stairs. This isn't all the property's fault - I'm sure it's Thyssen Krupp - who installed defective elevators - including designing a system that could take down all of the three elevators at once. But as consumers we don't think about the bad service work of Thyssen Krupp, but instead blame the hotel. It's just not the only little design flaw of the hotel . Aside from the parking debacle and lack of sufficient space, I don't understand how someone could have designed a swimming pool that small for a property that large. The heat still doesn't work so it now appears that there are three small pools but at some point in the future they will eventually fix the heating problems and then the sole remaining pool will be tiny (even if the glass bottom is very cool). Whether it's space in the cabinet of your room empty begging for a small refrigerator or an exercise room lacking earphones, this hotel still doesn't live up for the westin name. Which is ashame, because the hardworking staff, few of them that there are, are nice and make a great effort and should be recognized. Time for a management change to actually get this property to the level it should be. Hard to believe someone spent thirty plus million dollars to leave it at this state of functioning. I'm surprised at Starwood for allowing the property to open and operate at this level - it's a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Rooms, Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: twocoasts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Aug. 5 through 9 and were pleasantly surprised--especially after reading the less than stellar reviews. Positive: Our room was huge--two queen beds--not doubles--with a seating area, desk, etc. and plenty of room to spare. Excellent location--the metro is right across the street and Old Montreal is a two minute walk away. We walked to restaurants every night and found the area to offer lots of options. Cleanliness--our room was spotless, as were the common areas we saw. The bartender was very friendly and welcoming--and made good wine recommendations too. Room service was really fast--a plus after a late (10 p.m. arrival). Negatives: They are grossly under-staffed. They need at least four or five people on the front desk during peak periods. The most we saw was three. Fortunately for us, we didn't arrive or depart at peak, but I felt for those who were standing in line. The restaurant is crazy expensive. Breakfast for two (bagel with smoked salmon and a yogurt/granola parfeit with coffee for two: $49 with tip). Food was good though. They need a real gift shop with a real clerk.
